Additionally, I was unable to use the hotel's bikes as intended. I was told that bikes could not be kept past 10 PM, making it impossible to bike to dinner. For several consecutive days, when I inquired about a bike, I was told that the six complementary hotel bikes were taken and that I was welcome to go to a hotel-recommended store if I still wanted to rent one.  Of course I can rent one! Dont advertise a free bike program if your advice is to go to another company to spend money. Finally, I was surprised that staff insisted on collecting my borrowed umbrella nightly; the €20 rental hold was apparently not enough for them to be convinced I wasn’t going to steal it overnight. (@hotel: I promised not to steal it... It is in my room right now; please do not go upstairs and take it away from me, I want it for when it's raining later.)

I hope they will address these issues. Michaela at the front desk was extraordinarily helpful with many of the issues I encountered and she is fabulous, going well above and beyond. Truly exceptional!!!!
Unfortunately one helpful and attentive associate does not completely compensate for feeling thoroughly untrusted and unwelcome. This is not a cheap hostel! My stay was €500 per night! I expected a high quality comfortable stay; if I had known the issues, I would have stayed elsewhere. And bought myself a brand new umbrella every day.
Rating the breakfast and customer service. Food was ok but very overpriced not a smile insight from any of the staff.  Left quite disappointed for my first visit.

Nice hotel but no real hospitality here. The pros were the location and the Hoxton aesthetic and feel. Housekeeping was also very helpful and quick to respond. However, the staff while efficient, were cold and eager to usher you off. Later there was an issue with the billing, which I've never had at any other hotel, which I explained was distressing for personal reasons and needed to be dealt with quickly. No kindness, no offer of compensation or support, just a "sorry for the inconvenience" It is awful to feel like a nuisance when you are paying a considerable amount of money and it has really left a bad taste in my mouth.I would recommend spending your money at one of the many other beautiful hotels in London where you are made to feel like a valued guest,

The dish looked well-presented, but unfortunately, it arrived cold, which really took away from the experience. We then ordered our drinks — water and an Espresso Tonic. Completely disappointing. The Espresso Tonic came shaken and unappealing, which is unacceptable, especially for the most expensive coffee item on the menu.

I expected much more in terms of both taste and attention to detail.

cleanliness_negative.text: Not great, not terrible. I would give 2.5 stars if I could. First the bad: don’t believe their “Flexy” policy. It is a marketing scam and not honored. I reviewed the “policy” carefully before booking and nowhere did it say that it is not guaranteed. But I was emailed about the morning check in “not possible” the day before arrival (past free cancellation) and weeks after booking. Sure enough, my room was not ready when I arrived. Second, staff. They all know how to smile but all (with an exception of the manager whose name I didin’t catch) act kind of arrogant and condescending. You are definitely not treated as a priority and it seemed nobody really cared.  Third, lobby/restaurant. Lobby is always  full of local hipsters working on their laptops. Usually, boutique hotels that have small rooms provide large lobby spaces for you to chill. Not here. There is no room for the hotel guests to hang out as all lobby seats/couches are taken by the “locals”.  The restaurant hours are odd and the food is below average. Last, the rooms have no sound isolation and my room did not have temperature control at all. It did not matter what you set the thermostat at, it would still be the same hot. Housekeeping during your stay is only upon request.  If you are from the US and have stayed at Pali hotels, this hotel offers the same style and amenity levels, just double/triple the price (and Pali I think has bathrobes and slippers too, but not here). I felt that it consistently overpromised and underdelivered. The main good thing about this hotel was the location right in the middle of Nine Streets,. It was also clean and the shower pressure was great. But that’s pretty much where the positives end. Would not stay here again. Pullitzer one block over seems like a way better choice.

Felt unwelcome and untrusted. Death by a million papercuts:

Upon entering my room, I had been left dirty glassware. My sink had also been clogged or broken but I was told it could not be fixed for at least a day because I had checked in on a Sunday. An associate came to my room to try to help and used the room corkscrew to work on the plumbing — gross!!! Michaela jumped in and moved me to another room (which was much quieter as well, as a huge bonus — not a noisy one overlooking a very loud courtyard.) Thank you!!!

Housekeeping was skipped for the first two days despite my explicit request. (Daily housekeeping is not provided by default.) I also found the room lacked adequate storage, as there was no room for laundry or drawers, forcing me to keep my clothes on the floor.

My experience in the lobby was also consistently frustrating. Every time I attempted to sit down, I was told to move. I was informed that I couldn't sit in the hotel lobby unless I purchased something, couldn't sit by the window without ordering food, and couldn't sit at a table if I had a laptop. This occurred three days in a row. On one occasion, I ordered a drink and answered emails while I waited. Not permitted! a waitress directed me to a bench behind the reception desk, which was already fully occupied. There is no signage and no explanation of this. You must learn by chastisement.

Additionally, I was unable to use the hotel's bikes as intended. I was told that bikes could not be kept past 10 PM, making it impossible to bike to dinner. For several consecutive days, when I inquired about a bike, I was told that the six complementary hotel bikes were taken and that I was welcome to go to a hotel-recommended store if I still wanted to rent one.  Of course I can rent one! Dont advertise a free bike program if your advice is to go to another company to spend money. Finally, I was surprised that staff insisted on collecting my borrowed umbrella nightly; the €20 rental hold was apparently not enough for them to be convinced I wasn’t going to steal it overnight. (@hotel: I promised not to steal it... It is in my room right now; please do not go upstairs and take it away from me, I want it for when it's raining later.)

I hope they will address these issues. Michaela at the front desk was extraordinarily helpful with many of the issues I encountered and she is fabulous, going well above and beyond. Truly exceptional!!!!
Unfortunately one helpful and attentive associate does not completely compensate for feeling thoroughly untrusted and unwelcome. This is not a cheap hostel! My stay was €500 per night! I expected a high quality comfortable stay; if I had known the issues, I would have stayed elsewhere. And bought myself a brand new umbrella every day.

Wanted to treat myself and my partner for our stay in London but really felt like this was a waste of money.
Generally love the style of the hotel and the location was good for us as well. However was really disappointed by the lack of cleanliness of our room. The toilet seat was stained, the shower clearly hasn't received a deep clean in ages. Overall felt like it was only cleaned superficially and in a rush.
The beds are the absolute worst, as you are lying on a board of MDF with a mattress on top, which creaks if you move even a little bit, so not for light sleepers and uncomfortable as well. Water pressure in the shower is really low and since it's one of the newer hotels, you can't open the windows which of course is just my personal preference.
The staff was nice and apart from the cleanliness don't think they could do anything to change our experience, but would not come again.

The staff failed to clean my room when I called to ask for cleaning. room service food was cold and in the restaurant, there are MULTIPLE mice. If I could give this hotel 0 stars, I would. So sad because it’s somewhat cute.

Trendy hotel with ZERO attention to detail.

Where do I begin?

I stayed for 9 nights and my bed sheets weren’t changed once, I know this because there was a stain on them from when I accidentally spilt a little coffee the first morning.

The hotel hosted a very loud PFW event that went until midnight, they didn’t bother to notify guests beforehand.

They don’t restock ANYTHING in the room that you use or run out of i.e., water bottles, tea bags, coffee. When I asked, they acted like I was bothering them and I had to ask multiple times.

My teacups were replaced with dirty ones that had a lipstick mark on them.

Plastic cleaning gloves were left in the bathroom sink.

Restaurant staff will leave you sitting there for 30 mins without water. One waiter spilt my coffee all over the table and just walked off and didn’t bother to come back to clean it.

I left my room key at reception for someone to pick up, they lost it before the person even arrived.

When I arrived at 7:00am, the day of check-in, there was a man behind the coffee bar on his phone who did not once look up or offer to help me with my luggage. He just listened to me struggle across the cobble stones with two large suitcases.

I know this isn’t a five star establishment but for four stars and 450 euro per night, I’d expect the basics.

I am always polite and friendly, even when asking multiple times for things, so I know they weren’t just ‘sticking it to me’ for having a bad attitude.

Two of my colleagues stayed at the same time and had similar issues.

Save your money and stay at a boutique hotel where they will provide attentive service.

Rating the breakfast and customer service. Food was ok but very overpriced not a smile insight from any of the staff.  Left quite disappointed for my first visit.

On two most important things The Hoxton Amsterdam missed the mark badly!  Hope you don’t get room 108.

#1. The bed mattress was absolutely pathetic.  The mattress was some sort of springy bed, that sagged and had no proper support.  A hotel on this level should offer a proper bed.  This one should have been thrown out years ago.

#2.  The air conditioner was on, but provided nothing.  There was no cool air and didn’t even move the air.  From entering the first time the room was consistently stuffy with stagnant air.  The windows of room 108 on the first floor couldn’t be opened either. It was always warmer in the room than it was outside. After bringing it to the attention of the front desk, a fan was provided that did help. But the temperature of the room remained warm for our 3 day stay.

On positive notes, the location is great. The restaurant and lounge is beautiful. Staff was friendly and did what they could to help.

Decided to have breakfast in the lobby restaurant “Lottis” our last morning.  Service was fine, but my salmon benedict had some small grit in the chew.  I removed the sautéed spinach from the 2nd half and there was then no grit.  I suspect the spinach wasn’t properly washed before.

I stayed in 4 other hotels during my Europe trip and The Hoxton was disappointing.  Otherwise Amsterdam was charming but an uncomfortable hotel.

The staff failed to clean my room when I called to ask for cleaning. room service food was cold and in the restaurant, there are MULTIPLE mice. If I could give this hotel 0 stars, I would. So sad because it’s somewhat cute.

Location is great, but not sure it’s worth the money. Rooms are very minimalistic - no proper wardrobe, no body lotion. The AC in my room didn’t work, so it was super hot. The service in the restaurant is also very slow, and there was a mouse there…

noise_positive.text: Phenomenal stay! Great staff and super friendly. The room was quiet, clean, and trendy. Great location too. A perfect stay. Will definitely be coming back!

Perfect location, clean and comfortable rooms with in-room coffee maker, fridge, etc. The water, soda and coffee is restocked daily. The lobby though is a bit noisy due to the bar and restaurant present. But once in the rooms area, it is very quiet.

We had a great 9 night stay at the Hoxton Southwark. Loved the beautifully designed atmosphere of the hotel, the friendly and helpful staff, the quiet rooms, the comfortable beds, and most of all the fantastic South Bank location minutes from excellent theatres, museums, and great food (Borough market etc) and easy access to lovely walks on the river every evening.  We'll be back!

Hotel located on a beautiful quiet street right on the canal….. Literally one block away from all the amazing chaos that the city has to offer.   What a spot.

Room was beautiful overlooking the canal.  We couldn’t ask for better.

This hotel strikes a great balance between affordability and luxury. The bar and restaurant are fantastic, and the rooftop is a definite highlight—I highly recommend it. While the standard rooms are on the small side, making them best for a one or two-night stay, the staff are excellent. When I was staying weekly, they'd always be accommodating to my room preferences. I also loved how quiet the rooms were.

location_positive.text: Phenomenal stay! Great staff and super friendly. The room was quiet, clean, and trendy. Great location too. A perfect stay. Will definitely be coming back!
So well positioned on the canal side and easy to walk to all the attractions.  Great lively atmosphere all day and very good attention from lovely staff

We had a wonderful stay at the Hoxton on a short but much needed break from the US. Everyone was an absolute pleasure and the space / lounge area and bar were comfortable and relaxing after long days walking around Amsterdam. We can't wait to return.

Rooms overall are pretty decent, bathrooms are decently sized for the rooms. I do believe they need some upgrades like a proper nespresso machine and at breakfast they charge for bread for an omelette? Just little quirkly nickle & diming going on but decent. Location is great. Nice building.

We recently spent a night at the Hoxley and loved it. The service, food, drinks, and location were all perfect.

The views from the rooftop bar are amazing, as was the food and drink.

Highly recommend, I know I will be back.

food_beverage_neutral.text: I gladly visit this hotel on a regular basis: it provides a consistent experience of coffee & conversation, thanks in large part to the friendly staff. A special mention goes out to Fabio & Julia for delicious drinks, Maria & Leonor for quality service and Charlotte for a welcoming front desk. Keep up the good work, guys!

I gladly visit this hotel on a regular basis: it provides a consistent experience of coffee & conversation, thanks in large part to the friendly staff. A special mention goes out to Fabio & Julia for delicious drinks, Maria & Leonor for quality service and Charlotte for a welcoming front desk. Keep up the good work, guys!

Good location, lovely building and comfortable inviting communal areas. My cosy room was truly cosy, so much so that there isn’t anywhere to put your cosmetics in the bathroom other than on the shelf behind the toilet. The bed is very comfortable and the view was lovely, but unfortunately the room was cold as they haven’t turned the main heating on in the hotel. They gave me a Dyson fan heater but it’s not ideal when you wake up cold in the morning and don’t want to walk on the bathroom floor, until having cranked up the fan for 10 mins.
The food in the restaurant was good but really not anything special. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Location: Great – very convenient and pleasant.

Service: Could be improved. The barman was lovely and kindly made me a cappuccino while I was waiting to be seated for breakfast, which I really appreciated. However, the breakfast service itself was quite slow. I was the first to sit down, yet it took nearly 10 minutes for my order to be taken. After that, I waited around 10/15minutes for a small bowl of fruit and almost 20 minutes for the avocado toast — which unfortunately was prepared incorrectly. I ended up having to cancel it as I needed to leave for the airport. No one excused the poor service and gave a bit of an attitude when I was clearly bothered.

General vibe is really nice, check in and check out was easy and pleasant and most of the staff are lovely. I did find it odd that the manager also seemed to be scolding two of the employees at reception where it was very easy to hear.

If they had of been more attentive (particularly at a less busy time in the morning) the stay would have been more pleasant.
Friendly and professional  check in, but overall it was a mixed bag. Very comfy bed. Excellent food and service at Seabird. Dire food and service at breakfast. Overpriced wines.

If they had of been more attentive (particularly at a less busy time in the morning) the stay would have been more pleasant.

I stayed in Sept 2025 for two nights and had a warm and welcoming stay.  With a short walk to both the Southwark Tube station and to the river, its central location makes it easy to get to Covent Gardens and nearby neighborhoods.  The restaurant and coffee bar are great and bustling with energy on weekdays.  The barista, Daniel makes fabulous flat whites and the overall charm and vibe here are great.  My room was spacious and had a water kettle for tea and coffee and a fridge.  Overall, a great place to stay.

Super locatie, op loopafstand van Southwark metro. Vanaf daar zijn alle hotspots met 20 minuten te bereiken. Kamers zijn super: schoon en comfortabel. Cosy kamer was voor ons groot genoeg en eigenlijk groter dan verwacht. Prijs kwaliteit is top: Londen is een dure stad en voor deze prijs ervaar je echt comfort. Echt een aanrader!

Great hotel, loved the boutique styling and it had a great vibe. Locals seem to sit in the bar area all day. We had a cosy room which still had a 6 foot bed which was sooo comfortable and great facilities…shower gel…shampoo…conditioner..body lotion and fresh milk and carton water in the fridge. Staff were very helpful in both the reception and the restaurant. Brilliant location and it would be our first choice in the future.|Getting there tip from centraal station….we had trouble finding our way out of the station!! One side of the station is a canal…backside is the tram stops….trams 2…12..and 17 will drop you at Paleisstraat which is the nearest stop. (3 stops I think)

Cool rooms , efficiently sized, and great common areas. Cocktails are good, roof top restaurant is great. I like that you choose whether to have your room serviced everyday - great for the environment!

3.5 as I just can't warrant the room for the price.
Staff friendly and helpful
Could have done with more at breakfast as the poor lads were rushed off their feet
Food is nice even if the menu is a little precocious
Rooms are nothing special and you have to like that funky look
For the price I did expect more from my room

Got to chat tot the head bartender angelo and the bartender Berto who is sadly leaving soon. Both were great, both had fantastic cocktail recommendations and knew their stuff. Real gem

We had an excellent experience at The Hoxton Southwark. After a very disappointing situation at another hotel, we moved here at the last minute on a friend’s recommendation — and it completely changed our trip.||From the moment we arrived, Asher at the front desk welcomed us with calm, professionalism, and genuine care. His kindness made us feel safe, comfortable, and truly looked after. It was exactly what we needed in that stressful moment, and it turned our stay into something special.||Beyond Asher’s outstanding support, the hotel itself is fantastic — beautifully designed rooms, a great atmosphere, and warm hospitality throughout. Everything exceeded our expectations.||We would happily recommend The Hoxton Southwark to anyone visiting London, not only for the hotel itself but also for the amazing team members like Asher who make such a difference. Thanks a lot🙏🏻

Das Hoxton Southwark ist definitiv eine Reise wert! Schon beim Ankommen merkt man, dass dies kein gewöhnliches Hotel ist. Der Eingangsbereich geht direkt ins Restaurant über, die Rezeption ist etwas versteckt – was zunächst ungewohnt wirkt, aber perfekt zum modernen Konzept passt.||Das internationale Team ist unglaublich sympathisch und herzlich – besonders Justina bleibt in Erinnerung. Ein absolutes Muss ist das Restaurant „Seabird“ auf der Dachterrasse: mit fast 360-Grad-Blick über London, einer spektakulären Austern- und Seafood-Auswahl sowie spanischen Spezialitäten wie Pimientos de Padrón. Auch die Cocktails sind erstklassig – der Gin Tonic gehört zu den besten, die ich je getrunken habe.||Die Zimmer sind, typisch für London, eher kompakt, dafür aber makellos sauber, stylisch eingerichtet und mit liebevollen Details ausgestattet. Besonders praktisch ist die kleine Musikbox, mit der man Radio hören oder sein iPhone verbinden kann. Das Bad ist modern und elegant, das Oldschool-Telefon ein charmanter Retro-Akzent.|Auch nachts fühlt man sich bestens aufgehoben: ||Die Security sorgt nicht nur für Sicherheit, sondern gibt auch wertvolle Tipps für den Ausgang – ein echtes Unikat!||Fazit: Ein Hotel mit Charakter, Wohlfühlfaktor und einzigartigem Vibe. Vom Rooftop-Feng-Shui bis zum freundlichen Personal – hier passt einfach alles.

pricing_neutral.text: Friendly and professional  check in, but overall it was a mixed bag. Very comfy bed. Excellent food and service at Seabird. Dire food and service at breakfast. Overpriced wines.

3.5 as I just can't warrant the room for the price.
Staff friendly and helpful
Could have done with more at breakfast as the poor lads were rushed off their feet
Food is nice even if the menu is a little precocious
Rooms are nothing special and you have to like that funky look
For the price I did expect more from my room

£350 a night at The Hoxton Southwark and I got… the experience of pretending I live there and make my own bed. Unless you ask for housekeeping, nothing happens — no clean towels, no made bed, nothing.||Very chic décor, very trendy bar, but at this price point I shouldn’t have to file a request just to feel like I’m in a hotel and not an Airbnb with attitude. Cool isn’t a substitute for service.

Arrived to find the hotel didn’t have an accessible room for us, which I had booked. I had to show proof of booking before I was believed. Spent the first night in a totally unsuitable room. Were given a drinks ‘voucher’ but told we could not have the drinks we wanted (which would not have cost more than 2 from the prescribed list). After a bit of argument about it (most unpleasant) we left the bar without eating or drinking and went elsewhere for dinner. Having heard nothing further re an explanation or compensation, I chased up an explanation for the booking error. At this stage it was again claimed I had made the mistake and I had to show proof I had not. The manager then blamed the booking agency (Disloyalty) and said any compensation would have to come from them. The issue with the drinks was shrugged off as ‘standard policy’ (we have stayed at this hotel 7 times and previous complimentary drinks were provided without any such issues). To cap it all at checkout I was charged for breakfast bags which on my last 2 visits (they were all booked together) were free. Apparently it was a special offer to drum up trade. At that point I had had enough arguing. My visit was ruined. I spent a good deal of it in the room too stressed out and upset to do all the things we had planned. I won’t be back. I suspect the staff will just be relieved as I presume I was considered a nuisance the whole time.

Niet zo goed als ik gehoopt had, behoorlijk overpriced, leuke sfeer maar personeel absoluut niet vriendelijk, weet niet waar die goede beoordelingen vandaan komen, zijn veel fijnere hotels in Londen voor dit geld

noise_negative.text:
Felt unwelcome and untrusted. Death by a million papercuts:

Upon entering my room, I had been left dirty glassware. My sink had also been clogged or broken but I was told it could not be fixed for at least a day because I had checked in on a Sunday. An associate came to my room to try to help and used the room corkscrew to work on the plumbing — gross!!! Michaela jumped in and moved me to another room (which was much quieter as well, as a huge bonus — not a noisy one overlooking a very loud courtyard.) Thank you!!!

Housekeeping was skipped for the first two days despite my explicit request. (Daily housekeeping is not provided by default.) I also found the room lacked adequate storage, as there was no room for laundry or drawers, forcing me to keep my clothes on the floor.

My experience in the lobby was also consistently frustrating. Every time I attempted to sit down, I was told to move. I was informed that I couldn't sit in the hotel lobby unless I purchased something, couldn't sit by the window without ordering food, and couldn't sit at a table if I had a laptop. This occurred three days in a row. On one occasion, I ordered a drink and answered emails while I waited. Not permitted! a waitress directed me to a bench behind the reception desk, which was already fully occupied. There is no signage and no explanation of this. You must learn by chastisement.

Additionally, I was unable to use the hotel's bikes as intended. I was told that bikes could not be kept past 10 PM, making it impossible to bike to dinner. For several consecutive days, when I inquired about a bike, I was told that the six complementary hotel bikes were taken and that I was welcome to go to a hotel-recommended store if I still wanted to rent one.  Of course I can rent one! Dont advertise a free bike program if your advice is to go to another company to spend money. Finally, I was surprised that staff insisted on collecting my borrowed umbrella nightly; the €20 rental hold was apparently not enough for them to be convinced I wasn’t going to steal it overnight. (@hotel: I promised not to steal it... It is in my room right now; please do not go upstairs and take it away from me, I want it for when it's raining later.)

I hope they will address these issues. Michaela at the front desk was extraordinarily helpful with many of the issues I encountered and she is fabulous, going well above and beyond. Truly exceptional!!!!
Unfortunately one helpful and attentive associate does not completely compensate for feeling thoroughly untrusted and unwelcome. This is not a cheap hostel! My stay was €500 per night! I expected a high quality comfortable stay; if I had known the issues, I would have stayed elsewhere. And bought myself a brand new umbrella every day.
Loud DJ playing in lobby on weekends - this is NOT advertised on their website or by the front desk. Tried to get a different room and was offered ear plugs…

Trendy hotel with ZERO attention to detail.

Where do I begin?

I stayed for 9 nights and my bed sheets weren’t changed once, I know this because there was a stain on them from when I accidentally spilt a little coffee the first morning.

The hotel hosted a very loud PFW event that went until midnight, they didn’t bother to notify guests beforehand.

They don’t restock ANYTHING in the room that you use or run out of i.e., water bottles, tea bags, coffee. When I asked, they acted like I was bothering them and I had to ask multiple times.

My teacups were replaced with dirty ones that had a lipstick mark on them.

Plastic cleaning gloves were left in the bathroom sink.

Restaurant staff will leave you sitting there for 30 mins without water. One waiter spilt my coffee all over the table and just walked off and didn’t bother to come back to clean it.

I left my room key at reception for someone to pick up, they lost it before the person even arrived.

When I arrived at 7:00am, the day of check-in, there was a man behind the coffee bar on his phone who did not once look up or offer to help me with my luggage. He just listened to me struggle across the cobble stones with two large suitcases.

I know this isn’t a five star establishment but for four stars and 450 euro per night, I’d expect the basics.

I am always polite and friendly, even when asking multiple times for things, so I know they weren’t just ‘sticking it to me’ for having a bad attitude.

Two of my colleagues stayed at the same time and had similar issues.

Save your money and stay at a boutique hotel where they will provide attentive service.

1. We reserved the largest / most expensive room type in the property (“Biggy”), and were placed in a room on the 21st floor, which is one floor right below the rooftop nightclub which closes at 1am. There was loud dance music, vibrations from the bass, and people shouting that could be heard in our room until 1am, making it impossible to sleep. We were not given the option of having a quieter room when we checked in or when we booked - and the hotel only offered us a new room at 11pm on our final night, when my wife had already gone to bed. Are they running a hotel or a nightclub?

2. We were not told at check-in on Friday night that we need to inform the hotel that we would like our room cleaned on Saturday - so when we returned to our room on Saturday night, we found it completely untouched - not even the bed had been made! The front desk then explained that the Hoxton has a sustainability policy, but I am not sure how not making the bed helps a hotel be more sustainable? We are not asking them to replace the sheets, just merely tidy the room. Might as well have stayed in an Airbnb!

3. On the second night of our stay, we approached the front desk manager with our two complaints above, and he was apologetic - but then proceeded to give us a card with a stock/standard apology written on it about “apologies for the waiting time at check-in; please enjoy two drinks in the meantime” (that wasn’t even one of the issues we experienced!). This card entitled us to two free drinks in the bar, but it was 11pm when we received it and we were already in our room and checking out the next morning - so clearly we would have been unable to use it. It felt like a very impersonal, “tick-the-box” apology and the hotel staff did not really care about our concerns / complaints.

4. The location of the hotel is pretty random - it’s not really in center city Brussels, next to some major roads. Fortunately we didn’t care too much about this.

5. For a hotel at this price point, you would expect better amenities and facilities (at least a basic gym?). What was provided did not seem commensurate with the price on the room.

Arrival; Nobody at reception for several minutes. He Tried to check-in at the self check-in without sucess
Staff when they arrived could not find reservation, they will not call the person to clarify because it was Sunday evening
Very loud disco music in Reception made the conversation cumbersome.
Inspite of total amount for conference and room was prepaid, still the staff wanted even further deposit. First 150 euros and then another 100 euros.
Check-in Took more than 30 minutes, because reservation had to be made from scratch
Receptionist scornfully shouted  ‘goodbye sir, thank you very much sir, have a nice evening sir” after he had left the reception area to rush to the toilet.
But Almost impossible to find elevator to room. (Take one elevator, go through cafe/bar and take another elevator. No directions or help. There were No sports channel, to watch UEFA’s  nations league quarter finals. but lots of middle east channels
I will skip the first and the second day at the conference to make this complaint very long and complain about the third day.
There was nobody when the instructor arrived at 8:30 am. The room was not cleaned and the adapter used the first and second day was missing, even at 8;55 the coffee and croissant was not ready. The instructor however managed to start the conference at 9:00 without any adapter. During lunch the waitress dropped the tray full of oysters and ice water on the instructors shirt and suit. He conducted the afternoon smelling like oysters as there was no time to change. There are many more incidents like being served raw fish etc that I won’t bother to comment on.
The hotel further refused to reduce the amount of the invoice to reflect the actual number of participants and even pay for the dry cleaning of the suit.
Based on the above scenario and the hotel’s refusal to compensate, just responded we are sorry and apologies is completely unacceptable

cleanliness_neutral.text: £350 a night at The Hoxton Southwark and I got… the experience of pretending I live there and make my own bed. Unless you ask for housekeeping, nothing happens — no clean towels, no made bed, nothing.||Very chic décor, very trendy bar, but at this price point I shouldn’t have to file a request just to feel like I’m in a hotel and not an Airbnb with attitude. Cool isn’t a substitute for service.

Nice hotel in a great location.  Staff was very accommodating and friendly.  Downstairs restaurant was excellent; good selection of very well prepared food; good coffee.  Room was fine.  We didn't spend much time in it though; just for sleeping.  Beds (we had 2 twins) were comfortable and room was clean.  This is not a luxury hotel and we didn't expect it to be.  Tip: there are no washcloths so if you typically use one, bring one with you.

We stayed at this hotel two years ago and decided to return this summer, also recommending it to our friends. Unfortunately, both our past and current stays were marked by the same frustrating issue.

Two years ago, we were unexpectedly assigned a room designed for guests with disabilities. Traveling with a 6-month-old baby, this setup was quite inconvenient. The staff informed us that a room change could only happen the next day.

However, to our surprise, the same thing happened again this year—we were once again given a room for disabled guests. When we asked to change it, the staff said all other rooms were occupied and that next time we should specify our preference through the booking. Meanwhile, our friends who arrived two days earlier were given a standard room right away, without any special requests (they also have a baby)

To make matters worse, this time we didn’t enjoy the breakfast experience and our room wasn’t cleaned during our stay—we’re still not sure why.

Sadly, after this second disappointing experience, we will not return here again.

No breakfast despite asking, no room clean despite asking.

Otherwise ok
Clean well maintained rooms with comfortable beds and great bathrooms. Great atmosphere, fine restaurant and bar. Within walking distance of Brussels city center.

noise_neutral.text: Lovely rustic chic decor but they couldn't run a p*ss-up in a brewery! We wouldn't recommend staying due to issues at checkin, breakfast, rooms, noise. Our best friends room on his wedding day wasn't available as they had double booked!

The hotel overall is nice and very quiet which was amazing but the moment I entered the room I felt like in a closet. The room was so small I could not even do a stretch. Literally. I was hitting my knees on the table every time I came off the bed. The bathroom was half of the room.

The vegan breakfast was terrible - the fruit salad wasn’t fresh and the blueberry cake (?) was even worse. I asked for Matcha which they didn’t have.

Definitely won’t go back but I appreciate the good interior pieces.

Location is  abiout 20 minutes walk away from where you want to be (city centre). The room is good. Atmosphere in the foyer and the lounge is oppressive and dominating with loud awful music - jeez, is it designed to remove all the classy people? There is nowhere to relax, chill and chat without having to shout. That includes the restaurant, so we had to go somewhere else to eat both nights - your loss!! No decaf coffee but I know that's a pain for most euro cities. The loose tea was good

We stay at the hoxton every time we come to Paris due to the spacious rooms and reasonable price. You get more space for your money compared to similar priced boutique hotels. It can be very crowded and noisy on the weekends —lots of locals come and hang out and drink at the bar. If you like to party late at night and don’t mind the noise, it’s great. If you want a quiet hotel, stay somewhere else or maybe don’t book here on a weekend. It’s conveniently located near the metro (Bonne nouvelle and grand boulevard stations) and walking distance to the louvre, seine, and opera. Breakfast can be included with your room and it’s a proper sit-down breakfast, not buffet, which is great. But service is very slow and the food comes out cold every time. I would skip the breakfast and go to a local boulangerie instead. The restaurant is the only thing that didn’t impress me, otherwise it’s a great hotel.

We stayed at The Hoxton for 2 nights. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful upon check-in. The room was clean and styled nicely, however it did face the courtyard where the restaurant was so there was quite a bit of noise until late into the evening (popular late night spot). The restaurant was also very good and provided many options throughout the day. We loved the location as it was a short walk to most of the iconic Paris spots, and easy to access. We did have one small issue on an afternoon we wanted to utilize the cabanas, where we couldn't because a private party had booked but other than these couple of minor issues our stay was great. Would stay here again, maybe just with an outwardly facing room.

pricing_positive.text: Hip little hotel in a great neighborhood in Amsterdam.  Breakfast is a great value!  Good options on the menu, but never got a spoon, which meant I stirred my coffee with a fork, but that didn't work when I ordered the yogurt /granola bowl. Bed was comfy, but could use an upgrade in the bathroom.  Stayed in the largest room category, yet the space between the sink and the shower wall (18 inches) meant only a slender person could fit there.  Towel were a bit rough and we definitely needed washcloths!  Who washes their face with an enormous towel?  Provide face wipes if that is the "eco friendly" way to go. While it was a personal visit for a wedding, as a travel advisor, those little comforts would be missed by my clients.

I stayed 4 nights at this hotel in one of the cozy rooms. It is vibrant and lively hotel in a great location. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. I had a thumping noise in my room the second night and the hotel moved me to another room so I could sleep. The problem was fixed promptly and I enjoyed another 3 nights there. My only downgrades were on 1) room service hours, but snacks were available at the front desk for a reasonable price; and 2) lighting in the rooms is with bare Edison style bulbs which is harsh. A softer shaded light source would have been nice. Also, amenities are limited in room—no cotton swabs or cotton balls and no wash clothes. All minor. I will  definitely stay in Hoxton properties in the future.
Elevated aesthetics, great place for a drink, a few hours of work or a lunch under the glass ceiling. Reasonable prices and creative menu.
Lovely place and amazing staff. Just make sure your guests are informed if you change the prices

The Hoxton in Southwark is a stylish and comfortable hotel in a fantastic location, ideal for a city break or business stay. The aptly named Snug room is compact but cleverly designed, offering everything you need with a sleek aesthetic and a lovely bathroom to match. Service throughout is excellent, with friendly staff and flexible room cleaning on request. The breakfast menu is a real highlight - varied, tasty and well-priced, adding to the hotel’s overall great value. The only downside was the overly soft pillows, but that’s a small quibble in an otherwise thoroughly enjoyable stay.

wifi_positive.text:
Been to 16 Hoxton Hotels. This was my 40th stay with the brand overall. My 3rd stay at this location.

The location is great as you can walk to a lot of the tourists sights in the area. A tube station is close by and Network rail station is up the street. Safe area day and night too.

Hoxton is a great hotel. I got a room on the 6th floor facing West this stay. Good size room for one person. Might be a little tight for two people if you've tons of luggage but that's just how some cozy rooms can be.

If you're going to eat in the hotel then pick Seabird on the roof. Dinner is a perfect option as the views are something else.

I'd skip the £5 bag breakfast and get something on the street. Tons of great options in the area or a short tube ride away.

The hotel offers a chic and inviting atmosphere, with stylish interiors and attentive staff ensuring a comfortable stay. The rooms are thoughtfully designed, featuring large beds and powerful showers, complemented by modern amenities like free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs. I also used ukride.uk for my airport transfer to this hotel, and their service was excellent—punctual, smooth, and reliable, reflecting their top ratings on Google Maps. The location provides easy access to attractions such as the Tate Modern and Borough Market, making it an ideal base for exploring London. Overall, a fantastic experience that I would highly recommend.

A friend and I spent 4 nights in Amsterdam. I researched 6 boutique hotels in Amsterdam and ultimately landed on the Hoxton. It was a little pricier than some others but worth every penny. They had a variety of rooms to fit different price points. The #1 feature was location. It was a quick walk to just about everything we wanted to do so no money was wasted on taxis/uber except for the 20 min ride to and from the airport. #2 I would say is the rooms. I felt like I was in my own little apartment. The rooms had tall ceilings, windows that were equally massive providing lots of natural light but also had black out curtains. I was on the first floor with canal views. Despite the winter cold (we went in January) the rooms warmed up and felt very cozy. #3 Was the bar/lounge area which was so comfortable and felt like my living room. I was able to get good drinks and work on my laptop with the other remote workers, and charge everything to my room. One recommendation would be to update Lotti’s lunch/dinner menu. Some heartier comfort meals and go-to classics would have been nice. The wifi was great the entire stay and the staff were friendly. I’d definitely go back.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ 5/5

I had an absolutely wonderful stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Brussels!

Location:
The location couldn’t be more convenient—just an easy 8-minute walk from Brussels-Nord station, which made getting around the city and arriving from the airport incredibly simple. The area felt safe and was well-connected, with several public transportation options and restaurants nearby.

Facilities in the Room:
The in-room facilities were excellent. Everything I needed was available: a coffee/tea station, a large flat-screen TV, a mini-fridge, a safe, fast Wi-Fi. The air conditioning and soundproofing were also top-notch, making for a very restful night’s sleep.

Bathroom:
The bathroom was another highlight—it was modern, stylish, and very clean. The rain shower had excellent water pressure, and the layout was both functional and visually appealing. High-quality toiletries were provided, which added a nice touch of luxury.

Lobby & Design:
The overall design of the hotel is fantastic. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was impressed by the modern yet welcoming decor. Staff at the reception were friendly and professional, which really set the tone for the whole stay.

The Hoxton hosted a networking dinner and workshop for a corporate group of 25. The guest rooms and meeting facilities were very good. The service provided by all staff was excellent - all were very friendly, helpful, and quick to address problems / requests. Specific thank you’s to Ana the front office manager, Kate the events manager, Sakkoma the restaurant manager, and Sammy The Apartment (meeting facilities) host who added that something extra to elevate our experience from good to great!

wifi_negative.text:
Terrible night reception service. Staying at a hotel should at least come with equal treatment, but the night manager gave off an air of superiority over the guests. Extremely unpleasant communication that ruined our vacation. I checked in at your hotel on the afternoon of the 14th. Initially, I was impressed by the service and design aesthetics. However, my experience took a downturn when I encountered your night reception manager, he told me his name is JC.（sound）

After attending a show with my girlfriend, we returned to the hotel at night and realized we had misplaced our room key. We approached the front desk to request a replacement. One of the staff members, a sturdily built male who resembled a bartender (the other was a female), assisted us. He asked for my passport, but I informed him that it was locked in the room. He chuckled and said he had many questions to “interrogate” me with, as he couldn’t just let anyone claiming to have lost their key into a room. I agreed, and he proceeded to ask about my booking details, email, and phone number. I believe I answered four questions correctly. As he was pondering a fifth question, my girlfriend and I suggested that I could provide other identification, such as my driver’s license. He smile and retorted, “Why didn’t you offer that earlier? It would have saved us both some trouble.” I thought to myself, why didn’t he ask if I had other ID? Who is serving whom here? He seemed more suited for interrogations at a police station than hospitality.

Despite his arrogance, we didn’t want to argue, especially since it was Valentine’s Day. We resolved the issue, obtained the new key, and returned to our room.

Later, I encountered another issue: my phone couldn’t connect to the Wi-Fi. I called the front desk for assistance. The staff member advised me to reopen the login page. When I explained that it wasn’t working, he became impatient and insisted I come down so he could handle my phone himself. Valuing my privacy, and having already been unnecessarily questioned about my phone, email, and bank details earlier, I asked if he could guide me through the process over the phone. He responded, “If you come down, I can help you; if not, there’s nothing I can do.” I was taken aback. Having stayed in numerous hotels worldwide, most strive to assist their guests. It’s rare to encounter such unhelpful staff. I calmly asked for his name, and he proudly declared, “I’m JC, the night manager.” I suspect this JC is the same individual who earlier questioned my service professionalism.

I understand everyone has off days, but guests shouldn’t feel they’re being hassled, especially on special occasions when they’ve chosen your hotel for a memorable experience. It’s disappointing. Although a friend recommended your hotel, after this experience, I doubt I’ll return, as the service doesn’t align with the reputation and value I expected.

This is a beautifully designed hotel. Unfortunately the lounge and restaurant are the biggest let downs here.
The hotel has a massive service culture challenge and there appears to be no floor management addressing it. No F&B Management, no hotel management.

As a long stay guest, the restaurant menu and room service is far too sophisticated with very few options.

The lounge is filled with non hotel residents who use the free wifi and take up space for the entire day. There is no section for hotel guests and you literally have to wait for a couch to free up.

At the price, Accor need to do better.

wifi_neutral.text: I love this place. I'd give 100 stars if I could. The Hoxton welcomed me with warmth, calm, and comfort when I arrived around 10pm on a Saturday night after fleeing a truly awful hotel one block away, The check in desk could not have been more efficient and the staff could not have been kinder or more attentive.||The lobby is a vibe: chic, low-lit, and welcoming enough that I found myself working comfortably there on my laptop for hours. Internet was lightning fast. Even, the other hotel guests were fun to chat with in the elevator too. The room was spotless, the bed heavenly, and the bathroom—hot water, beauitful tile, luxurious soaps and shampoos—felt like a real reset. The air conditioning in the summer days was divine!||Breakfast was delicious and included the best naan I’ve ever had from the Indian restaurant on-site. On a rainy day, I stayed in the lobby for a salad (see photos), spicy lemonade and an oat milk latte. I even bought a T-shirt to remember my stay.That’s saying something. I’ll definitely be back!!||If you still aren't sure after my review, google Time Out Hoxton and read that review.

community_negative.text: No concierge so no help with luggage not even a warm welcome from reception staff.  In fact the staff look and act just miserable and unhelpful.  Tv doesn’t work properly and not exactly state of the art with no mirroring or Bluetooth facilities.  Room smells of smoke and after allegedly being thoroughly cleaned again still smells.  Got  a roomy room which is no bigger or better than a friends cosy room so don’t waste your money on that.  Breakfast poor and 4€ for a piece of alleged sourdough toast is quite simply extortion.  Lobby and bar area is extremely cold and again staff unfriendly and slow with used glasses and plates left lying around. Despite being a member of the disloyalty scheme and therefore a fan of the HOX I am embarrassed by this hotel after recommending to a friend we stayed here. No atmosphere here at all other than bad attitudes all around.  Having stayed at Shoreditch, Barcelona and Paris Hoxton’s you would think staying in Berlin Hox was a completely different hotel brand.  I would recommend the powers that be send all the staff to Paris so they can see how it’s done.  Won’t be using the HOX again and will not be renewing my disloyalty membership which most staff don’t know how to administer on their Epos systems and what actually is included.   Thank you and goodbye Hoxton’s it’s been a blast apart from Berlin!

If you like a hotel full of hipsters - you are in the perfect place: but beware the attitude of the crew.
The Boutique Hotel is nestled in the Charlottenburg district close to the Zoo.
Rooms are tiny and in sixties style and beds mostly only Queen size.
If you only speak German you might be lost as most of the people don’t speak the language.
The Bar Wintergarden seems mostly occupied by hipsters and IT freaks. Servers don’t pay any attention as we waited more than 10 minutes on 3 different occasions as they don’t pay any attention.  Food orders likely to be mixed up (names on the Menu in German and they don’t understand what I wanted).
Forget Silverware, no ketchup/mayo offered or salt/pepper w/food so you basically have to do their job asking (don’t forget anything as they will give you a good eye roll if you bother them).
The amount of attitude is overwhelming (also from the front desk).
They don’t mess around with you means don’t expect help or admittance to mistakes.
Ordered a package, called ahead to let the hotel know and they surely refused it - great.
No apologies or even a phone call to the room.
Don’t expect too much from the breakfast bag besides an old apple and a cereal bar.
The breakfast ist in the Indian Restaurant and Indian inspired- there will be no buffet.
Maybe I’m not hip enough or too old - not planning to come back.

Quite disappointed of the overall value as it is quite expensive.  Broken ac in the room, building equipment is getting old very quickly (carpets and doors)..  had some rude encounter with the breakfast people. Entrance is nice. Pool is a a kid bath.

1. We reserved the largest / most expensive room type in the property (“Biggy”), and were placed in a room on the 21st floor, which is one floor right below the rooftop nightclub which closes at 1am. There was loud dance music, vibrations from the bass, and people shouting that could be heard in our room until 1am, making it impossible to sleep. We were not given the option of having a quieter room when we checked in or when we booked - and the hotel only offered us a new room at 11pm on our final night, when my wife had already gone to bed. Are they running a hotel or a nightclub?

2. We were not told at check-in on Friday night that we need to inform the hotel that we would like our room cleaned on Saturday - so when we returned to our room on Saturday night, we found it completely untouched - not even the bed had been made! The front desk then explained that the Hoxton has a sustainability policy, but I am not sure how not making the bed helps a hotel be more sustainable? We are not asking them to replace the sheets, just merely tidy the room. Might as well have stayed in an Airbnb!

3. On the second night of our stay, we approached the front desk manager with our two complaints above, and he was apologetic - but then proceeded to give us a card with a stock/standard apology written on it about “apologies for the waiting time at check-in; please enjoy two drinks in the meantime” (that wasn’t even one of the issues we experienced!). This card entitled us to two free drinks in the bar, but it was 11pm when we received it and we were already in our room and checking out the next morning - so clearly we would have been unable to use it. It felt like a very impersonal, “tick-the-box” apology and the hotel staff did not really care about our concerns / complaints.

4. The location of the hotel is pretty random - it’s not really in center city Brussels, next to some major roads. Fortunately we didn’t care too much about this.

5. For a hotel at this price point, you would expect better amenities and facilities (at least a basic gym?). What was provided did not seem commensurate with the price on the room.

**Serious Safety Issue and Unacceptable Staff Response**
The hotel itself is beautifully designed, with clear attention to detail and an atmosphere that initially feels welcoming. However, my experience was entirely overshadowed by a grave safety issue and an appalling response from the staff.

During my stay, the lift doors malfunctioned and forcefully closed on my shoulder, causing significant pain. When I reported the incident to the reception and later escalated it to the manager, the response was shockingly dismissive. The manager outright refused to review the CCTV footage and treated my concerns with disbelief and disrespect.

It is utterly unacceptable that a hotel which invests so much in aesthetics and guest experience would fail so profoundly in ensuring basic safety and professional conduct. A beautifully designed hotel is meaningless if the staff does not prioritise the well-being of its guests.

I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this hotel to anyone, as no guest should have to endure such treatment—especially when reporting a safety concern.

**Rating:** ⭐

---

**Schwerwiegendes Sicherheitsproblem und inakzeptable Reaktion des Personals**
Das Hotel ist wunderschön gestaltet, mit viel Liebe zum Detail und einer Atmosphäre, die auf den ersten Blick einladend wirkt. Doch leider wurde mein Aufenthalt durch ein gravierendes Sicherheitsproblem und die erschreckende Reaktion des Personals völlig überschattet.

Während meines Aufenthalts klemmten die Türen des Aufzugs aufgrund eines technischen Defekts mit großer Wucht auf meiner Schulter, was erhebliche Schmerzen verursachte. Als ich den Vorfall der Rezeption und später dem Manager meldete, war die Reaktion schockierend gleichgültig. Der Manager weigerte sich kategorisch, die Überwachungskameraaufnahmen zu prüfen, und begegnete meinen Bedenken mit Unglauben und Respektlosigkeit.

Es ist schlichtweg inakzeptabel, dass ein Hotel, das so viel in Ästhetik und das Gästeerlebnis investiert, bei grundlegenden Sicherheitsmaßnahmen und professionellem Verhalten derart versagt. Ein schönes Design ist bedeutungslos, wenn das Personal nicht die Sicherheit und das Wohlbefinden der Gäste an erste Stelle setzt.

Ich kann dieses Hotel nicht empfehlen, denn kein Gast sollte so behandelt werden—insbesondere nicht, wenn er ein Sicherheitsproblem meldet.

**Bewertung:** ⭐

location_positive.text:
Great rooms, location and access to public transport
Only thing is ... the housekeeping missed cleaning my room all days :(

While the room is literally a bed (if you have claustrophobia pls avoid!) it was very clean and functional.  That said the reason to choose this hotel is both its location and its amazing staff.  While you might not even need to contact the staff, given the digital tools at your disposal, when you do they are warm, fun, helpful and kind.  They really take the hotel from ok to excellent in my opinion.

Nous avons trouvé cet hôtel avec le Web . Tout est magnifique surtout le lobby , l’accueil de l’équipe et la vibe en entrant . Hôtel très net techno. Les chambres sont petites mais très techno aussi . Pas de machine à café dans les chambres pas d’eau en bouteille , pas de frigo. On doit demander la glace au bar qui vous l’offre avec un sourire et sans charge.selon la tendance on aimerait que l’hôtel offre un verre en échange d’un absence de nettoyage par jour ce qui semble de plus en plus populaire voilà !point positif la location de vélos est incluse donc gratuite .

Super personeel! het hotel is heel modern met een leuk uitzicht en super goed gelegen. je kan de verschillende moods aanpassen in de kamer via een tablet, ze hebben zelfs een eige joga video dat je op tv kan afspelen. er is een metro sration rechts van je als je de deur uitwandeld en wat verder rechts light de markthal. Echt cozy stuff

Wir waren zum zweiten Mal hier.
Das Hotel ist klasse!

Die Zimmer sind modern und ausreichend groß, wenn man mit moderatem Gepäck (maximal ein Koffer) reist. Das Bett ist sehr gemütlich.

Das Personal ist durchweg freundlich und zuvorkommend.
Das Frühstück hat ein gutes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis; es sind frische Barista-Kaffeespezialitäten im Preis inkludiert.

Die Lage ist unschlagbar, direkt an der Bahnstation Blaak und der Markthalle. Die Sehenswürdigkeiten Rotterdams sind alle fußläufig erreichbar.

Ebenfalls sehr empfehlenswert sind die Drinks von der Bar. Das Hotel ist komplett auf bargeldlose Bezahlung eingerichtet, man kann alles über die App begleichen.

room_quality_positive.text:
Great rooms, location and access to public transport
Only thing is ... the housekeeping missed cleaning my room all days :(

Idéalement situé, cet hôtel moderne apporte tout le confort nécessaire dans les chambres. Petit déjeuner avec du choix et très bon. Le service est impeccable (si vous le souhaitez n’oubliez pas de demander via la tablette dans la chambre !). Mieux encore, j’ai oublié un effet personnel et l’hôtel a été hyper réactif : en même pas 3 jours c’était retourné chez moi ! Au top.

Just spent three days in Rotterdam and couldn’t be happier with the citizenM hotel. The room was perfect and the staff were really friendly and welcoming. When I go back I will definitely stay there again.

This was my second time around and again it was a lovely experience. I like the interieur design, the big beds and tv to watch from the bed. But most of all I want to compliment the staff. I met this great lady (working Sunday night 28-9) who made my stay felt like my birthday. Such friendly service with a smile. Hope to come back someday!

While the room is literally a bed (if you have claustrophobia pls avoid!) it was very clean and functional.  That said the reason to choose this hotel is both its location and its amazing staff.  While you might not even need to contact the staff, given the digital tools at your disposal, when you do they are warm, fun, helpful and kind.  They really take the hotel from ok to excellent in my opinion.

service_neutral.text: Site très agréable, une Deco de qualité et originale bravo.||Un accueil de qualité. Un service toujours intelligent ||

The room (303) is very small, too small for travellers that have to sit down for doing some office work: a desk is simply not provided, because there's no room for it. An old-fashioned bed-side switch for switching on a light is dearly missing: the room has a handheld pad and a collection of switches that are partly dependent on the pad's info. Quite fashionable but user-unfriendly. The shower has a hand-held spray nozzle that cannot be fixed in a useable position. And finally: the room relies on automatic air-conditioning. Fine, but apart from that this implies that guests cannot open a window for really fresh air, and that your sleep must be able to withstand the permanent rumbling sound of the fan, in CitizenM this results in super-dry air. We had to put on the shower on its hottest for half an hour just to make the room's air breathable. That cannot be the purpose of a hot shower in an otherwise environment-friendly hotel
Super friendly team who are knowledgeable and very helpful.  Their attention to detail was great especially when asking for something a little different.

I stayed in the Citizen M in Rotterdam recently, the location is really convenient to the central of Rotterdam and is just outside the Rotterdam Blaak train station. The staff are really friendly and welcoming. The room was nice and perfect size for me and I enjoyed the modern feel to it. Overall a great stay.

That was my second staying in your hotel. Both my husband and I find the place a beautiful and affordable choice, with very good amenities and super friendly ambassadors. Both times we enjoyed our time there.

The staff are really friendly and welcoming. The room was nice and perfect size for me and I enjoyed the modern feel to it. Overall a great stay.

Landed myself randomly at CitizenM due to last minute need to change accomodation. A change that turned out for the better: pleasant atmosphere, the friendly, knowledgable staff and the luxurious feel of the room. Location will be hard to beat: walking distance of the city centre and all public transport at your doorstep, and let's not forget the complimentary bike! Great experience and highly recommended.

Stopped here as a couple for a few days. Right on the doorstep of Markthal, the twice weekly market  and the Cube Houses, with easy access for trams/metros/trains. Room was clean and nicely spec'd. First time at CitizenM but probably won't be the last. Will look them up when we choose our next destination.

Das Hotel liegt direkt am alten Hafen, man kann von dort aus alle Wege zu Fuß gehen. Es ist sehr modern, und versucht, technisch aktuell zu sein, aber die Erläuterungen sind nur auf Englisch und Niederländisch. Für Deutsche nicht ganz verständlich, wenn es sich um technische Dinge handelt.

pricing_positive.text: Truly first rate staff. Great hotel experience. Breakfast as good as could be expected. Solid value for money overall.

Stayed at citizenM Amsterdam and it was such a unique experience. For €180 a night, you get compact but super high-tech rooms with a layout I’ve honestly never seen before. (Video attached)

The design is smart, space-efficient, and everything from the bed to the bathroom setup feels sleek and modern. 🛏️🚿

One of the coolest features is the mood lighting, you can actually change the colors while you shower, which makes it feel a bit trippy and fun. Definitely adds to the experience .

Overall, it’s not a traditional hotel vibe, but if you’re into modern design and clever tech touches, it’s a memorable place to stay.

Ratings:
🛏️ Room Comfort & Design: 4.5/5
🛎 Service & Ambience: 4/5
💸 Money’s Worth: 4/5

Tip: Don’t miss playing around with the shower lighting; it’s part of the fun!

The location was exactly where I wanted to stay. And the price was lower than I thought, so I had to ask my friends in Rotterdam if this is a hostel room or no.
when I made the reservation, I wrote a comment for requesting a view for Oude Haven. I did not even know if they read it but when I arrived to my room, I understood they read it! And I asked this after checkout if they read it, they said yes and they specially gave me that room. Thanks for that again.
My room was super useful. Small room but have all what I need for this stay! and I loved how you adapted technology to hotel room. I was able to control everything with the tablet near of my bed, even air conditioner & curtains!
I did not had much things to talk with staff but whenever I had to talk them, they were super friendly & helpful.
if I ever come to Rotterdam again, I will definitely stay in this hotel.
and a little tip to football fans. if you are coming to Rotterdam for a football game against Feyenoord, Oude Haven is the meeting point for away fans before the game. and this hotel is located just in there. so, you can't find a better place than this.
thanks again.
Amazing service in terms of food.. rooms are a bit small but manageable, very good stay ! Definitely worth staying!

The strangest and most unique hotel we have ever visited. On the one hand, it is located outside the city center, but its location is excellent because it is very close to the southern train station, including every intercity transport you can imagine. Also a good location for arriving at the airport. The rooms in the hotel are very compact, there is no place to put your belongings. The bed is huge. All the room control is done via a small tablet. Breakfast is cheap and starts at 6 am!!! But we enjoyed the service the most. It was simply excellent.

food_beverage_positive.text: Truly first rate staff. Great hotel experience. Breakfast as good as could be expected. Solid value for money overall.

Un bel hotel, ottima posizione. Hotel ben pulito, la cosa che mi è piaciuta tanto è il letto super comodo e grande che occupa quasi mezza stanza, l'unica cosa che non mi è piaciuta e soprattutto molto scomoda è stata la doccia, nonnostante abbiamo fatto tanta attenzione a non far uscire l'acqua, abbiamo dovuto utilizzare anche le tovaglie a nostra disposizione per asciugare tutta l'acqua uscita di fuori.
Nella stanza è presente anche una cassaforte.
Personale super attento,  accogliente e sorridente a qualsiasi ora.
Al bar c'è la possibilità di portare l'acqua in bottiglia di vetro totalmente gratuita.
Danno anche la possibilità della bici gratuita utilizzando la tessera della camera, e hanno anche gli ombrelli a disposizione in caso non siate attrezzati🔝

Al bar c'è la possibilità di portare l'acqua in bottiglia di vetro totalmente gratuita.
Danno anche la possibilità della bici gratuita utilizzando la tessera della camera, e hanno anche gli ombrelli a disposizione in caso non siate attrezzati🔝

Nous avons trouvé cet hôtel avec le Web . Tout est magnifique surtout le lobby , l’accueil de l’équipe et la vibe en entrant . Hôtel très net techno. Les chambres sont petites mais très techno aussi . Pas de machine à café dans les chambres pas d’eau en bouteille , pas de frigo. On doit demander la glace au bar qui vous l’offre avec un sourire et sans charge.selon la tendance on aimerait que l’hôtel offre un verre en échange d’un absence de nettoyage par jour ce qui semble de plus en plus populaire voilà !point positif la location de vélos est incluse donc gratuite .

Wir waren zum zweiten Mal hier.
Das Hotel ist klasse!

Die Zimmer sind modern und ausreichend groß, wenn man mit moderatem Gepäck (maximal ein Koffer) reist. Das Bett ist sehr gemütlich.

Das Personal ist durchweg freundlich und zuvorkommend.
Das Frühstück hat ein gutes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis; es sind frische Barista-Kaffeespezialitäten im Preis inkludiert.

Die Lage ist unschlagbar, direkt an der Bahnstation Blaak und der Markthalle. Die Sehenswürdigkeiten Rotterdams sind alle fußläufig erreichbar.

Ebenfalls sehr empfehlenswert sind die Drinks von der Bar. Das Hotel ist komplett auf bargeldlose Bezahlung eingerichtet, man kann alles über die App begleichen.

At the heart of the old port-great position.
Rooms ade controlled by a ipad - very user friendly. Breakfast is fine enough. Yes, i do recommend.

location_neutral.text: I stayed in the Citizen M in Rotterdam recently, the location is really convenient to the central of Rotterdam and is just outside the Rotterdam Blaak train station. The staff are really friendly and welcoming. The room was nice and perfect size for me and I enjoyed the modern feel to it. Overall a great stay.

Landed myself randomly at CitizenM due to last minute need to change accomodation. A change that turned out for the better: pleasant atmosphere, the friendly, knowledgable staff and the luxurious feel of the room. Location will be hard to beat: walking distance of the city centre and all public transport at your doorstep, and let's not forget the complimentary bike! Great experience and highly recommended.

Stopped here as a couple for a few days. Right on the doorstep of Markthal, the twice weekly market  and the Cube Houses, with easy access for trams/metros/trains. Room was clean and nicely spec'd. First time at CitizenM but probably won't be the last. Will look them up when we choose our next destination.

Very comfortable to stay in and accessible as well. Staff were also really nice and friendly. ||There were also a lot of variety for breakfast, and it was helpful we can have them early (from 6am) as well.

I’m probably going to buck the trend with this review. The hotel itself is in a good location and the reception area is nice. We didn’t have breakfast but it’s probably best to pre-book as we found outside more expensive. The guy who checked us in was patronising - he asked us if we were keeping up with what he was saying - we are English, he was speaking in English - we couldn’t quite see what the problem was. |We had a problem with our sink and the maintenance guy turned up at 0800 the next morning as soon as he started work. Great service. |The rooms were dire. Comfy beds but the toilet was in the room and enclosed only by glass you had to encase yourself in. Dreadful and no privacy whatsoever. The shower was the same. |We found it pretty ridiculous that everything g had to be done via an iPad - from turning on the tv to turning the lights on. We just found the concept ridiculous.|Our room reeked of smelly drains. We mentioned this to the reception staff but nothing was done about it.

pricing_neutral.text: That was my second staying in your hotel. Both my husband and I find the place a beautiful and affordable choice, with very good amenities and super friendly ambassadors. Both times we enjoyed our time there.

This place's prices strategy is absolutely bonkers. Went for a prcedure around the croner whilst a colleague worked in the bar area of the lobby of the hotel. They bought a hot chocolate. I came back and joined them, and was told it cost 29.99Euros to sit there, I said it was only for 15 minutes whilst they finished their call. The worker said fine and said I needed to buy something. I mean, fine, I asked them for a hot chocolate but was told, clearly, they don't do waiter service. So I went and bought another hot chocolate, gave it to my colleague and waited in the bar area, I was told I had to be if I didn't pay the 29.99working rate for the office. Fine.||My colleague came back and the person came to talk to us and I said "I'll take a beer and another hot chocolate". I was then informed because my colleague had been there, for an hour they must pay 29.99Europs now otherwise they can't buy food or drink. I said, "Just so I get this, I can only buy them a drink, if they pay 29.99 but I can buy something for myself ?", yes was the reply.||They will literally REFUSE to take your money, unless you pay a 29.99 fee first. They told me it was because it was prioritising their guests who wanted to use the facilities. It was empty, loads of empty tables there.||I'd heard of "bar fines" in the go-go bars of Thailand where you have to pay money to the owner if you take a worker home, but I'd never heard of being charged to buy drinks in the West. Didn't realise it was THAT sort of bar....||I've stayed in the Savoy, The Ritz, The Shard, fortunate to stay in the world';s top hotels but never come across this. I honestly thought it was a joke when he was telling me. I guess they've got too much money already because they lost out on 2x sales right there.

Conoscevo la catena CitizenM M per essere stato ospite in quel di Roma.|L’hotel di Amsterdam conferma le aspettative.|Posizione: 3 stelle. Fuorimano rispetto al centro, ma vicinissimo alla stazione di Amsterdam Sud e quindi alla metro, ma anche alla fermata dei tram.|Struttura: 4 stelle. All’esterno un po’ anonima, ma dentro si sente lo stile Citizen. Pulizia dappertutto e molta domotica.|Camere: 4 stelle. Ampie e con il letto accostato alla finestra che é un po’ scomodo, ma è una caratteristica di questi hotel.|Colazione: 4 stelle. Varia anche come tutti gli hotel del nord Europa orientata sul salato.

I paid €145 per night w/o breakfast. The service was very friendly, and both the large lobby and the bike rental were convenient. Rooms on the back side of the hotel are quiet — much appreciated. However, I wasn’t too happy with the room’s aesthetic and interior design. The shower cubicle and sink combo in the entrance area felt like one of the cheapest, most plastic-looking solutions I’ve seen in a hotel. On-site parking is reasonably priced, but you can find cheaper options on the nearby riverside street if you prefer.

community_neutral.text: Landed myself randomly at CitizenM due to last minute need to change accomodation. A change that turned out for the better: pleasant atmosphere, the friendly, knowledgable staff and the luxurious feel of the room. Location will be hard to beat: walking distance of the city centre and all public transport at your doorstep, and let's not forget the complimentary bike! Great experience and highly recommended.
This is the marvellous place with super friendly people and charming vibes. Staying here exceed all expectations.

It’s very close to the financial district( few minutes walking) and also close to the center of Amsterdam. People that work here are nice and helpful. The room layout is interesting and takes some getting used to.

Hotel’s location is superb, within walking distance of the river bank and popular shopping avenues. The room is small because it is Europe, but designed in the way that everything fits well and you don’t feel crowded or inconvenient. Smart technology allows you to control everything from an iPad. So it is compact but efficient for solo travelers in particular. BT the way, nice staff and good/clean reception area dubbed as a living room for socializing.

I can’t speak highly enough about this place.  If there wasn’t places to see in Amsterdam you could easily have a holiday just chilling and getting immersed in the dreamy groovy atmosphere of the hotel lobby.  Bed is super comfortable and you won’t be in a hurry to leave the shower.  My favourite hotel chain by far.

Wonderful stay here as always. Well located on the edge of the city centre, with tram station around the corner. Super clean, friendly staff. I personally really like the open-plan rooms… refreshing compared with the traditional layout. Would definitely recommend.
