Hôtel lounge really beautiful and quality of bed amazing.||Domotic is cool. Rooms were quiet.||||Otherwise we were désappointed by amfully rude man at the reception - no smile - not welcoming. No Willigness to help. Read contract carefully - zéro explanations are given of then extra charges are given because she should have read it better … I Will never come back.

I stayed here for a conference at the RAI. The room layout is unique in that the toilet and shower are both pretty much out in the open. There is a curtain that can be drawn to partition the room, but since I was travelling alone, I didn't need to use it. I stayed in a room facing the inner garden which was quiet enough to get some good sleep. The morning autumnal walk to RAI across the park was pleasant, especially since it wasn't raining. Overall, I would say that it is a good place to stay for solo travellers who need easy access to Schiphol and RAI.

I paid €145 per night w/o breakfast. The service was very friendly, and both the large lobby and the bike rental were convenient. Rooms on the back side of the hotel are quiet — much appreciated. However, I wasn’t too happy with the room’s aesthetic and interior design. The shower cubicle and sink combo in the entrance area felt like one of the cheapest, most plastic-looking solutions I’ve seen in a hotel. On-site parking is reasonably priced, but you can find cheaper options on the nearby riverside street if you prefer.
Shoreditch is a good area to explore with so many shops, bars and restaurants. The hotel is so quiet and we both slept well.

wifi_neutral.text: Really good hotel. The rooms are not big, but the bed is huge and comfortable, the room is quiet, dark and a good temperature, the shower is good, the wifi works well, the breakfast is good and the staff are friendly and helpful. What more can you ask for?

CitizenM Shoreditch left much to be desired, especially considering the price point. Let me break down my 5-day stay experience:

The good: Superior room automation (everything controlled via tablet), excellent WiFi connectivity, convenient location for business travelers, and handy luggage lockers. The building has Lime bicycle stations right outside, and the vibrant nightlife across the street is a plus.

The bad: The room design is bizarrely impractical with a sink placed awkwardly in the sleeping area, and rooms are surprisingly smaller than budget hotels like Travelodge. The £20 breakfast feels overpriced for the limited variety offered.

The ugly: The elevator situation is an absolute nightmare - 80% of the time they're out of service, forcing guests to wait endlessly or use stairs. Staff seemed indifferent to these issues. Rooms facing the metro line suffer from significant noise intrusion, though internal soundproofing is decent.

While the location is prime for Shoreditch exploration and business trips, the consistent elevator problems, basic amenities, and cramped rooms make it hard to justify the premium pricing. You're essentially paying for the trendy brand name rather than superior comfort or service.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

community_positive.text: Nous avons trouvé cet hôtel avec le Web . Tout est magnifique surtout le lobby , l’accueil de l’équipe et la vibe en entrant . Hôtel très net techno. Les chambres sont petites mais très techno aussi . Pas de machine à café dans les chambres pas d’eau en bouteille , pas de frigo. On doit demander la glace au bar qui vous l’offre avec un sourire et sans charge.selon la tendance on aimerait que l’hôtel offre un verre en échange d’un absence de nettoyage par jour ce qui semble de plus en plus populaire voilà !point positif la location de vélos est incluse donc gratuite .

Stayed at citizenM Amsterdam and it was such a unique experience. For €180 a night, you get compact but super high-tech rooms with a layout I’ve honestly never seen before. (Video attached)

The design is smart, space-efficient, and everything from the bed to the bathroom setup feels sleek and modern. 🛏️🚿

One of the coolest features is the mood lighting, you can actually change the colors while you shower, which makes it feel a bit trippy and fun. Definitely adds to the experience .

Overall, it’s not a traditional hotel vibe, but if you’re into modern design and clever tech touches, it’s a memorable place to stay.

Ratings:
🛏️ Room Comfort & Design: 4.5/5
🛎 Service & Ambience: 4/5
💸 Money’s Worth: 4/5

Tip: Don’t miss playing around with the shower lighting; it’s part of the fun!

The location was exactly where I wanted to stay. And the price was lower than I thought, so I had to ask my friends in Rotterdam if this is a hostel room or no.
when I made the reservation, I wrote a comment for requesting a view for Oude Haven. I did not even know if they read it but when I arrived to my room, I understood they read it! And I asked this after checkout if they read it, they said yes and they specially gave me that room. Thanks for that again.
My room was super useful. Small room but have all what I need for this stay! and I loved how you adapted technology to hotel room. I was able to control everything with the tablet near of my bed, even air conditioner & curtains!
I did not had much things to talk with staff but whenever I had to talk them, they were super friendly & helpful.
if I ever come to Rotterdam again, I will definitely stay in this hotel.
and a little tip to football fans. if you are coming to Rotterdam for a football game against Feyenoord, Oude Haven is the meeting point for away fans before the game. and this hotel is located just in there. so, you can't find a better place than this.
thanks again.

I stayed at CitizenM Rotterdam for a recent work trip, and it was truly one of the best hotel experiences I’ve had.

The location is ideal, just a short walk from the office district, which made commuting to meetings incredibly easy. The room itself was modern and thoughtfully designed, with a tablet that controls everything (lights, blinds, TV, temperature), super convenient after a long day.

The bed was incredibly comfortable, and I slept better than I have in most hotels. Add to that the kind and genuinely human service from the staff, and you get an experience that feels far beyond standard business travel.

A small misunderstanding on my part was handled with so much generosity and grace by the team, it honestly left me touched. It’s rare to come across hospitality that feels so sincere.

I’ll definitely be staying at CitizenM again for all my upcoming business trips, no question!

Perfektes Hotel für einen Städtetrip.
Zimmer sind zwar sehr klein, aber für ein paar Tage ausreichend für 2 Personen. Steuerung von Licht, Klimaanlage, Jalousien, etc. geht via iPad.
Eigenes Smartphone lässt sich via Chromecast mit dem TV verbinden (Prime, Netflix, etc.).
-Check-In und Check-Out geht super schnell an den Terminals.
-Modernerne Aufenthaltsbereiche
-Gratis Wasser
- Mit der Trambahnlinie 5 in ca. 10 Minuten in der Stadt. Haltestelle ist nur etwa 300 meter vom Hotel entfernt.
Wir würden auf jeden Fall wieder kommen :)

Perfect hotel for a city trip.
The rooms are very small, but sufficient for two people for a few days. You can control the lights, air conditioning, blinds, and more with an iPad.
You can connect your own smartphone to the TV via Chromecast to watch Prime, Netflix, and other services.
-Check-in and check-out are super fast at the terminals.
-Modern lounge areas
-Free water
-The tram line 5 takes you to the city in about 10 minutes. The stop is only about 300 meters from the hotel.
We would definitely come back :)

room_quality_negative.text: Good bye Citizen M! You have been such a cool concept. I loved you. Sadly a financial group acquired you and some smart businessmen have been involved. As a result, the room now comes with two pillows instead of four. Conceivably two are now hidden in the drawer under the bed. Good idea for costs and environment. But it would be so nice to have a note to let the guest know that this is an option. Speaking of which, room cleaning now comes as an option. You must proactively ask instead of proactively refuse…. To add insult to injury, now there is no more glass in the room. Drink out of the tap citizen!!! You lost it guys. Too bad. Hospitality and innovation are not anymore part of your DNA!

I’ve stayed at numerous CitizenM hotels across the world and this is easily the worst customer service ever experienced. We had water damage in our room for our honeymoon and simply asked for a change of room and one night refund due to water damage to our passports (clear water damage on them), designer items wet/ moist, clothes damp/ moist and was told that it is against their companies policy to offer any discounts and/or refunds. Thankfully, other people witnessed and mentioned they have been refunded before for issues at their other locations.

Update: to add, we had an employee come into our room and he also confirmed we had water all over our walls! He also felt the pillows and bed and apologized.

Checking in was good but the shock came when I saw my room. It reminded me of a prison I once visited. The layout and positioning of the shower and toilet what a turnoff. One bath towel with brown stains wasn’t very inviting to dry my body with. When brushing my teeth above the sink I smelled something really bad and rotten turned out to be coming from the sink. No possibility to open a window was hell because the AC is on but “fresh air” as the hotel claims? No not really. All in all very disappointing. Only English speaking staff?

Worst citizenM I've stayed in. This place smells like urine. changed rooms thinking it was just one but it's all of them. The shower and toilet are separate which is super annoying.
The blinds are not black out and rusted (why?).
The AC barely works and it's so hot with no fresh air for this urine smell. Otherwise, a citizen M as one would expect.
Good location, at least.

Stop with your AI reviews i talked to the staff about ventilation it simply dont work !!! The tech is horrible also TV with no chanels super hard to stream bad bad

Rooms are just too small can hardly turn in it.
If it was a way to use less space and give a better rate I can understand but the price is like any other hotel. The ventilation is really bad and with now window to open not good at all.
On staff extreamly unpolite gave the bike key to another staff then I was basically shout at.  The availability of bikes just not enough.
The laundry service please give other options took 3 days to get and totally squezed clothes in a small bag and very expensive.

I had a very bad expereince with lost and found service. I was rushing in the morning I left the hotel and left everything on the desk excluding item that costs more then 200 euros. I contacted them after 4 hours of train travel and they came back to me in 2 days. It was enough time if anybody tried to grab the item and sell it in the secondhand market. The hotel does not do a quality check on the cleaning service. Do not leave valuable in the room. Cleaning clerks may come, take them, and say the items were not there!

Cramped, Confusing, and Uncomfortable -
This hotel is a perfect example of tech overdesigning comfort. The room layout is terrible – the toilet and shower are right next to the bed with awkward, hard-to-use doors. There’s no real ventilation, the space feels stuffy, and there are no windows, which makes it feel more like a capsule than a hotel room. The sink is tiny and right beside the bed, so water ends up spilling everywhere. Overall, the room felt cramped, uncomfortable, and far from cozy. Definitely not worth the money.

Expensive rates but "low-cost" experience. I paid 330€ for one night plus taxes and no breakfast. I thought this was a business hotel and I found is one of those new "low-Cost/ do it yourself" experience.
- You have to check yourself in and yourself out.
- The room was extremelly small. The bed touches end to end with the walls, and you feel you are in a cage.
- The bathroom is a sub-section of the room with a glass wall, where toilet and shower are very close to each other. The sink is in the room! (no kidding...)
- The A/C is always on!!! because the window cannot be opened.
You can tune it, but i set it up to max temp and min vent and I froze.
- It has only one light option: all lights on, or all off. Bizarre.
- My toilet was dirty. I write this the last, becasue I am sure that was an unfortunate mistake, however that's how I founf it.
- Staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel is kind of ok is you get it at a very cheap price, because is a low cost experience. At the normal rate, I do not recommend.
pricing_negative.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

- The A/C is always on!!! because the window cannot be opened.
You can tune it, but i set it up to max temp and min vent and I froze.
- It has only one light option: all lights on, or all off. Bizarre.
- My toilet was dirty. I write this the last, becasue I am sure that was an unfortunate mistake, however that's how I founf it.
- Staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel is kind of ok is you get it at a very cheap price, because is a low cost experience. At the normal rate, I do not recommend.
cleanliness_negative.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

cleanliness_negative.text: I stayed here 2 years ago for a work trip and stayed in another CitizenM in California for work and oh my goodness this has to be the absolute WORST brand of hotel out there. I came back just to write this review because I got reminded of how traumatic my stay was. The room felt like living in a coffin - it was that tiny and stuffy. They provide ZERO room service in a 4 star hotel which is just ridiculous actually even low star hotels have room service someone needs to rebuke their stars or the hotel brand needs to go out of business. I would never stay here of my own accord I only stayed there because I was forced to by my job. I was staying there in winter and they don’t provide any adequate bedding or pillows, don’t allow deliveries to the room which is ridiculous because then why don’t your staff just deliver it?? Also the thermostat is always broken. They don’t provide enough towels you always have to request everything - even a simple room cleaning. it doesn’t feel like staying in a hotel it feels like your staying at a place where you are unwelcome. The people who created this hotel should really take a course on hospitality or learn something from the east where even lower star hotels provide good hospitality. The whole place is cheaply done. The lights are glitchy. I wish they would just go out of business. The sinks are smaller than airplane sinks water just gets all over your place. Even apartments in nyc are bigger than these rooms

As a guest who stayed at least 10 different Citizen M hotels, again I was so excited to stay at Citizen M and this was Labubu expectation Lafufu reality situation.

I read the reviews before, and other guests talked about elevator not workin from 1.5 ago, and THEY ARE STILL NOT WORKING!
Shame on an establishment who couldn't fix their elevators for 1.5 months as a hotel.

The sheets had stains, the room cleaning was below avarage compared to other citizen Ms. So avoid this one and use your money to something else.

location_negative.text:
I’ve stayed at numerous CitizenM hotels across the world and this is easily the worst customer service ever experienced. We had water damage in our room for our honeymoon and simply asked for a change of room and one night refund due to water damage to our passports (clear water damage on them), designer items wet/ moist, clothes damp/ moist and was told that it is against their companies policy to offer any discounts and/or refunds. Thankfully, other people witnessed and mentioned they have been refunded before for issues at their other locations.

Update: to add, we had an employee come into our room and he also confirmed we had water all over our walls! He also felt the pillows and bed and apologized.

Worst citizenM I've stayed in. This place smells like urine. changed rooms thinking it was just one but it's all of them. The shower and toilet are separate which is super annoying.
The blinds are not black out and rusted (why?).
The AC barely works and it's so hot with no fresh air for this urine smell. Otherwise, a citizen M as one would expect.
Good location, at least.

Great hotel, lovely location, nice food.
Very  unhelpful with issue that arose over payment for booking. After a cancelled flight I booked the hotel through booking.com, paid for it and got a receipt from booking.com, confirmed money had been taken out of account.on arrival and check I. I was asked for payment again, but showed the transaction to check in agent and after discussion was allowed to check in. Was approached alter at bar to pay again and again explained the issue, staff were very pleasant and professional and again issue appeared to have been resolved. On checkout I was completing electronic checkout and was requested to pay again. I did not press the pay button but the check out agent did and a further payment was taken from my account. I discussed it with the check in agent and he said there was nothing they could do. As issue was with booking . Com. I contacted them and they advised me to contact hotel. I did and was told nothing they could do. Called Helpdesk and explained issue again nothing they can do. Very frustrating morning. Polite, helpful people but in terms of customer service was very poor.

The worst citizenM I’ve been to. Location next to the metro somewhat makes up for it. The rooms and hallway seem older. We got a higher room with “scenic” view but our view was a construction site with barely the river in the background. Our bathroom door didn’t close and we had to leave  the room to get each other privacy. We asked twice in one day to get it fixed and they said maintenance would come, which they never did. The 16th floor bar is completely indoor and seems dated as well. The mojito was good though.
location_negative.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

location_negative.text:
Bed against window facing a building in construction . Terrible when waking on a Monday with workers facing you despite scenic view displayed on reservation
Service provided by lovely young people who seem to strive as human robots . The place is not reflecting French or Parisian culture /living
The breakfast is not appropriate for healthy eating
The warm food especially is not consumable .
Despite been situated in a convenient place. Not recommended. Price does not reflect the bad or lack of quality
location_negative.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

service_negative.text:
I’ve stayed at numerous CitizenM hotels across the world and this is easily the worst customer service ever experienced. We had water damage in our room for our honeymoon and simply asked for a change of room and one night refund due to water damage to our passports (clear water damage on them), designer items wet/ moist, clothes damp/ moist and was told that it is against their companies policy to offer any discounts and/or refunds. Thankfully, other people witnessed and mentioned they have been refunded before for issues at their other locations.

Update: to add, we had an employee come into our room and he also confirmed we had water all over our walls! He also felt the pillows and bed and apologized.

Checking in was good but the shock came when I saw my room. It reminded me of a prison I once visited. The layout and positioning of the shower and toilet what a turnoff. One bath towel with brown stains wasn’t very inviting to dry my body with. When brushing my teeth above the sink I smelled something really bad and rotten turned out to be coming from the sink. No possibility to open a window was hell because the AC is on but “fresh air” as the hotel claims? No not really. All in all very disappointing. Only English speaking staff?

Stop with your AI reviews i talked to the staff about ventilation it simply dont work !!! The tech is horrible also TV with no chanels super hard to stream bad bad

Rooms are just too small can hardly turn in it.
If it was a way to use less space and give a better rate I can understand but the price is like any other hotel. The ventilation is really bad and with now window to open not good at all.
On staff extreamly unpolite gave the bike key to another staff then I was basically shout at.  The availability of bikes just not enough.
The laundry service please give other options took 3 days to get and totally squezed clothes in a small bag and very expensive.

Ho soggiornato più volte nei CitizenM di Londra e Parigi, ad Amsterdam era la prima volta e purtroppo sarà anche l’ultima. Non mi piace lasciare recensioni negative, ma ci sono stati alcuni fattori che hanno reso la permanenza poco piacevole.
PRO:
1. letto king size con topper comodissimo
2. Posizione comoda per spostarsi sia in treno verso l’aeroporto e altre città, sia verso il centro con il tram che ferma praticamente davanti
3. Ambassador sempre disponibili e pronti ad aiutarti
CONTRO:
1. La stanza era freddissima. Abbiamo chiesto di alzarci la temperatura, aspettato che si aggiornasse il sistema, ma in camera si moriva di freddo. Si potrebbe pensare di far andare il clima solo per qualche ora dalle 11 alle 15 e lasciare agli ospiti la scelta di accenderlo o meno anche di notte. Così è insopportabile. Non vedevamo l’ora di uscire.
2. Le pulizie totalmente da rivedere. Al check-in ore 15.30 la stanza non era ancora pronta, nei giorni seguenti le pulizie venivano fatte nel tardo pomeriggio quando rientravamo. Un giorno non ci hanno messo la carta igienica, poi mancavano gli asciugamani e un altro giorno proprio non le hanno fatte anche se erano state richieste.
3. Il bagno così allestito con wc e doccia divisi in due sorte di cilindri sono molto scomodi. Anche la zona per riporre le cose è poco pratica rispetto ad altri hotel della stessa catena. Il primo CitizenM in cui ho trovato un phon scarso!

I had a very bad expereince with lost and found service. I was rushing in the morning I left the hotel and left everything on the desk excluding item that costs more then 200 euros. I contacted them after 4 hours of train travel and they came back to me in 2 days. It was enough time if anybody tried to grab the item and sell it in the secondhand market. The hotel does not do a quality check on the cleaning service. Do not leave valuable in the room. Cleaning clerks may come, take them, and say the items were not there!

Avoid! Unless you enjoy spending time in a lobby shared with mice…

I’ve been a loyal guest at CitizenM for over five years, staying dozens of times. The great location, vibrant atmosphere, and practical rooms once made it my top choice.
Unfortunately, that’s no longer the case.

The hotel is now overrun with mice, the rooms are poorly maintained, and even basic amenities like towels are torn. It feels as though the hotel has completely lost its respect for guests.

food_beverage_negative.text:
Worst citizenM I've stayed in. This place smells like urine. changed rooms thinking it was just one but it's all of them. The shower and toilet are separate which is super annoying.
The blinds are not black out and rusted (why?).
The AC barely works and it's so hot with no fresh air for this urine smell. Otherwise, a citizen M as one would expect.
Good location, at least.

Voor een hotel en het personeel in de bar/restaurant beneden: 0 sterren qua gastvriendelijkheid voor niet slapers. Ik had een informele zakelijke bijeenkomst. Wij namen plaats aan een tafeltje met vier vennoten. Een bestelling plaatsen kan niet. Die moet je ophalen aan de bar. Ook als je iets simpels wilde eten. Elke keer moet je het afhalen. Zes keer gezegd dat ik geen kamer heb maar gewoon een bon wil en betaal na afloop. Niet mogelijk. Wisseling van dienst: toen was het wel mogelijk een bestelling te plaatsen en te krijgen aan tafel! Ideaal! Vervolgens kwam de avondploeg, er ontstonden woorden tussen de ene en de andere ploeg omdat ze geen bon mochten maken maar wij telkens gewoon meteen moesten afrekenen per losse bestelling van ons allen.  Een grote wanvertoning. Ik kom -niet arrogant bedoeld- vaker in 4 en 5 sterrenhotels. Dit was een aanfluiting naar je gasten toe. Grootste ergernis: geen woord Nederlands kun je er spreken. Saluut en de kost! Tot nooit weerziens.

De retour au CitizenM après un super séjour précédent, j’ai été déçue par cette nouvelle expérience. L’ambiance n’était plus la même sans Aaliyah, barmaid et hôte exceptionnelle, toujours accueillante et de bon conseil. On m’a appris qu’elle ne faisait plus partie de l’équipe… et moi non plus, je n’y reviendrai pas. Une vraie perte pour cet espace que j’aimais tant.
food_beverage_negative.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

food_beverage_negative.text:
Expensive rates but "low-cost" experience. I paid 330€ for one night plus taxes and no breakfast. I thought this was a business hotel and I found is one of those new "low-Cost/ do it yourself" experience.
- You have to check yourself in and yourself out.
- The room was extremelly small. The bed touches end to end with the walls, and you feel you are in a cage.
- The bathroom is a sub-section of the room with a glass wall, where toilet and shower are very close to each other. The sink is in the room! (no kidding...)
- The A/C is always on!!! because the window cannot be opened.
You can tune it, but i set it up to max temp and min vent and I froze.
- It has only one light option: all lights on, or all off. Bizarre.
- My toilet was dirty. I write this the last, becasue I am sure that was an unfortunate mistake, however that's how I founf it.
- Staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel is kind of ok is you get it at a very cheap price, because is a low cost experience. At the normal rate, I do not recommend.
food_beverage_negative.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

noise_positive.text:
The rooms are very small and very cold, but super clean with interesting layouts.
The location is far enough from the city center to be nice and quiet, but close enough to walk (30 min walk to the city center).

I'll start by saying I am biased - I love citizenm hotels as they're always so clean and dependable. But this is the best one I've been to by far! The location is fab - out of town so nice and quiet at night but very close to the metro and nearby RAI. Super friendly staff and spotlessly clean. Will definitely be staying here again!
Super comfy and quiet room. Loved all the room controls! We stayed here as we had a train from Gare de Lyon the next morning and it was perfect - rolled out of bed to the station!
noise_positive.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

noise_positive.text:
First time staying at a CitizenM hotel. Been wanting to try them for a few years now.

The stay was great. The rooms wasn't big but It was compact and well designed. Has everything you need for your stay.

The iPad control system was easy to use. The mini fridge worked great. There was not noise from outside even with picking the Westward train viewing room.

I did not try any food on site, so I can't speak to that but the lobby was spacious and chill looking.

A high tech hotel in the heart of a trendy neighborhood, the citizenM hotel Shoreditch was an ideal place for a couple visiting London for the first time. Shoreditch is on the West and North side of London. Close to the downtown area, Shoreditch was within walking distance to tube stations and buses. Liverpool Street station is not far from the hotel and from there you can go anywhere in the city. We walked down the A-10 to the OXO building and had a reservation for the Sky Garden at OXO. The number 8 bus stop is about a block away from the hotel outside the Shoreditch High Street station making it easy to navigate to St. Paul's Cathedral or along the Thames River. Our room had a king size bed with a beautiful shower and a small/narrow sink and makeup table. There is an iPad next to the bed to control the lights, temperature, and television. You can order room service or visit the 24-hour lounge on the second floor behind the reception area. One night after coming back to the hotel after 10 PM we ordered a plate of nachos and ate in a quiet corner of the restaurant. You can pre-order breakfast for £13 per person (£16 same morning) or take a short walk across the courtyard to a coffee shop. There are two restaurants also located just outside the hotel and lots of small pubs and places to eat close by. CitizenM was a convenient place to stay in London for sightseers and those who want an upscale, tech hotel for a good price.

wifi_positive.text:
Highlights:

Cleanliness: 9.1/10
Rooms are spotless, with guests appreciating the high standards of hygiene.

Comfort: 9.0/10
Beds are cozy and rooms are well-designed, though compact.

Location: 9.6/10
Located near popular attractions like Markthal, cube houses, and public transport. Perfect for sightseeing.

Facilities: 8.8/10
Modern amenities include smart technology for controlling lighting, temperature, and entertainment.

Staff: 9.4/10
Friendly and attentive staff, often highlighted as a strong point.

Value for Money: 8.4/10
Great for its price, but some guests feel the room size could be bigger for the cost.

Wi-Fi: 9.1/10
Fast and reliable internet.

Pros:

Modern, tech-savvy rooms.

Vibrant and stylish communal areas.

Convenient location near restaurants, shops, and transport.

Self-check-in and efficient service.

Cons:

Rooms are small, which might not suit everyone.

Limited storage space in rooms for extended stays.

No traditional room service or large restaurant.

The citizenM Hotel is about a 10-minute walk from Liverpool Street and well connected to all major stations. Reception is on the first floor with a self-check-in system, which unfortunately didn’t work for us. The rooms and the hotel overall are very clean and well maintained. There is only one type of room: for two people with a toilet and shower. With lots of luggage, the room feels cramped, but it’s manageable. The shower and toilet are only separated by frosted glass. The entire room can be controlled by tablet, and a safe is provided. Despite the noisy surroundings, the hotel itself is very quiet and pleasant. The windows cannot be opened. Free Wi-Fi is available and worked well. The service was excellent: staff were always friendly and helpful. Requests like an extra blanket or towels were immediately fulfilled. The hotel bar is nice, offers a wide selection of drinks, and is open 24/7. We even received complimentary black tea. For two rooms and four nights, we paid over £1000 (without breakfast), which is acceptable for London given the location.
Summary: Clean, friendly, and well-maintained hotel with small rooms at a high but fair price.

Orginal German:
Das citizenM Hotel ist etwa 10 Gehminuten von der Liverpool Street entfernt und gut von allen großen Bahnhöfen erreichbar. Die Rezeption befindet sich im 1. Stock, wo ein Self-Check-in möglich ist, der bei uns jedoch nicht funktioniert hat. Die Zimmer und das gesamte Hotel sind sehr sauber und ordentlich. Es gibt nur einen einzigen Zimmertyp: ein Raum für zwei Personen mit Toilette und Dusche. Mit viel Gepäck wird es schnell eng, es ist aber machbar. Die Dusche und Toilette sind nur durch Milchglas vom restlichen Raum getrennt. Das gesamte Zimmer kann über ein Tablet gesteuert werden, ein Tresor steht ebenfalls zur Verfügung. Trotz der lauten Umgebung ist es im Hotel sehr ruhig und angenehm. Die Fenster lassen sich allerdings nicht öffnen. Kostenloses WLAN ist vorhanden und hat stets funktioniert. Der Service ist ausgezeichnet: Alle Mitarbeiter waren freundlich und ansprechbar. Wünsche wie eine zusätzliche Decke oder Handtücher wurden sofort erfüllt. Die Hotelbar ist nett, bietet eine große Getränkeauswahl und das rund um die Uhr. Wir bekamen sogar kostenlos schwarzen Tee. Für zwei Zimmer und vier Nächte haben wir über 1000 £ (ohne Frühstück) bezahlt, was für die Lage und London insgesamt in Ordnung ist.
Zusammenfassung: Sauberes, freundliches und ordentliches Hotel mit relativ kleinen Zimmern zu einem zwar teuren, aber dennoch fairen Preis.

Superb hotel. Right in the centre of Shoreditch and all its restaurants bars shops. Stone throw from Brick Lane, Spitalfields Market and easy walk into the City of London. Excellent rooms operated by Ipad. Enormous beds. Great breakfast. Wi-fi the bar, decor everything is spot on.

Really Good! Stayed here in February 2025 as a couple. The staff were awesome, really friendly and welcoming. The rooms were really good, trendy décor, good size, functional layout, clean, bed was massive, the room was control via a tablet and the shower was good. Staff and food/Drink are available all night as well. The communal areas are great as well. It has included WiFi throughout the place/rooms.
Unfortunately, when we tried to use the smart TV in the room, it did not work. The staff offered a room move but we had unpacked, it was late and we could not be bothered. So when you get in the room, check the TV before you settle in. They did offer us other compliantly offers. They do not have their own car park, so you have to sort out your own parking if you drive. Really good place to stay!

The first thing to say is that I didn't stay here, I use it as an occasional office, one of the perks of their annual membership programme.

However all their rooms tend to be the same, small, functional but modern.

This is one of their quieter London hotels which may be a bonus if having a meeting or doing work calls. The public living room area is pretty big, well designed, plenty of sockets and fast WiFi.

Location wise this is in the middle of Shoreditch, Liverpool St is about a 10-15 minutes walk away. Plenty of eating, drinking and entertainment options nearby

wifi_negative.text:
Arrivo: devi fare tutto da te su un ipad della malora. Arrivi in camera e cercare dove sono le luci, wifi, tapparelle ti fa girare i coglioni che la metà basta. Stufo dei bnb senza  servizio di concierge, Cosa vado a fare in un hotel dove tutto è complicato.
Dimenticavo: il letto messo contro 3 muri della camera una ca*gata pazzesca
wifi_negative.location: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon hotel

wifi_negative.text: Au téléphone c'est anglais et impossible de les joindre, peu importe le code qu'on appuie dessus. ⭐️⭐️⭐️✨ (3.5/5)

Mama Shelter Lille is a vibrant and lively hotel that really captures the fun, playful spirit the brand is known for. The XXL room we stayed in was impressively spacious — stylishly designed with modern touches, cozy bedding, and plenty of room to relax. The location is another huge plus, perfectly situated near the train station and the city center, making it easy to explore Lille on foot. The breakfast was also a highlight — fresh, plentiful, and full of variety, from pastries and fruit to hot dishes and great coffee.

However, while the overall atmosphere was enjoyable, a few key issues made the stay less comfortable than it could have been. When the room experienced a blackout and power trip, the recovery process was disappointingly slow. It took quite some time before the issue was addressed, largely because there didn’t seem to be any technical staff on-site to handle it promptly. This was frustrating, especially given the level of service one would expect from a well-known hotel brand.

The air conditioning was another letdown. It barely seemed to work, leaving the room uncomfortably warm and stuffy, particularly during the night. Even with the windows open, there wasn’t enough ventilation to cool the space down properly, which made sleeping difficult.

Overall, Mama Shelter Lille has the potential to be an excellent stay — the design is modern and fun, the food is great, and the location couldn’t be better. But the lack of technical support and weak air conditioning really affected the comfort level. With a bit more attention to maintenance and faster problem-solving, it could easily go from good to great. As it stands, it’s a stylish and convenient hotel with charm — but one that still needs a bit more substance behind the style
Amazing stay from start to finish, from the parking, to the rooftop bar! The food in the restaurant was amazing, room was incredible, and super dog friendly, would highly recommend!

Nous rentrons d'un citytrip au Luxembourg.  Cet hôtel est une "pépite" ❤️ Sa décoration, son ambiance feutrée et colorée, sa situation proche du centre-ville accessible par le métro gratuit, son restaurant animé d'écrans et de musique 🎵 et son parking privé font de ce lieu un site incontournable pour un week-end hors du commun. Je le recommande chaleureusement.

I stayed at Mama Shelter Luxembourg and while the hotel has its perks, there were a few things that left me disappointed. First, I was surprised to find no slippers in the room, which is typically a standard offering at most hotels. When I asked about it, the response was “please buy it,” which felt a bit off for a hotel of this caliber.

The room itself was clean and well-maintained, which I appreciated. However, I would have liked to see complimentary bottled water in the room, as well as a liquid soap dispenser rather than the solid soap provided (including shampoo). It was a bit inconvenient for showering.

On a positive note, the breakfast was fantastic! It was definitely the highlight of my stay – great selection, fresh, and tasty.

Overall, while the breakfast was excellent and the room was nice, I think Mama Shelter Luxembourg could improve in terms of amenities and customer service for a more complete guest experience.

In Lille where cobbled stories wind,|A haven waits for hearts to find—|Mama Shelter, bold and bright,|A tapestry of warmth and light.||Its colors dance, its music plays,|A modern soul with vintage grace.|From cozy beds to rooftop skies,|Each corner holds a sweet surprise.||The food? Divine. Each bite a kiss,|A symphony you won't want to miss.|Cocktails crafted, smooth and bold,|A toast to tales yet to be told.||But what lifts Mama to the stars,|Beyond its lights and stylish bars,|Is service rare, sincere, and true—|And Yen, the gem that sees you through.||With every smile, he lifts the day,|With humor, heart, and savoir-faire.|Attentive, kind, and always near,|He brings the magic atmosphere.||So if you roam through northern France,|Give Mama Shelter more than a glance.|Stay, indulge, and raise your pen—|To Lille, to life, and cheers to Yen.

Mama Shelter Lisbon is a fun and stylish spot with a lot of character. The location is fantastic—very central and convenient for exploring the city. One of the highlights is definitely the rooftop bar, which has an amazing view over Lisbon and a great atmosphere, especially in the evenings.||The rooms aren’t huge, but they’re comfortable and well-designed, with everything you need for a short stay. The restaurant and overall design of the space are trendy and vibrant, though we didn’t get a chance to try the food.||It’s worth noting that the vibe leans more toward a younger crowd—lively, modern, and social—so if that’s your scene, you’ll feel right at home. Overall, a great choice for a stylish and central Lisbon stay.

It wasn’t a pleasant stay overall . I noticed the broken tap at the bathroom as a first thing and I informed the reception. I was told that someone will come to fix it the next day but no one came. My hand was touching to the sink and dirty water at some point while washing my hands. There were flies in the room even though I didn’t open the window. The last day I saw a bug in the toilet. The toilet paper holder was loose. I went to the rooftop and ordered Roast-beef but they didn’t tell me there are 2; one with the hash-brown  and tomatoes and the other one is simple. So they brought the expensive one which was 10 Euro more. Also they charge you extra during the check in and they deduct from this amount when you consume food and drinks that was a bit confusing and unnecessary makes it hard to track. The rooftop was nice. The food was good at the restaurant. Breakfast was also good I had 2 times.

Second time at this hotel for a business trip. The beds are comfortable but the rooms are either too hot or too noisy.  Apart from one little carton on arrival, no water provided. No coffee / kettle in the room. (Tip: Buy a big bottle from the supermarket and put it in the fridge).

Breakfast is a bit disappointing for the price. (Tip: Go to one of the cafes nearby instead).

The bar can be very loud and getting served takes a while, but the decor and surroundings is very nice.

Both times the roof terrace has been closed.

The staff is always very good. Always nice to see the same, friendly faces.

Having stayed in a few other Lisbon hotels, I would take Mama Shelter but it's not the Mama experience of other cities.

The restaurant was pretentious but not good, the pea purée was just butter, I asked for the filet of my fish to be raised and got a poorly done filet full of bones. On top of it, I was told that I needed to get a print of my card but instead, It was a full sum of money taken which made me pay fees with my Amex. To avoid.

Underneath its cool design I found Mama Shelter a coldhearted hotel. My dog was charged 25 euros but got nothing in return: no dog bed, no water bowl, not a single dog biscuits… A good thing I brought a travel mat for my dog to sleep on because it’s clear that Mama dislikes pooches. I have only one good thing to say about this hotel: great breakfast offer with the best scrambled eggs I ever had. That’s it. All the rest: mèh!

Le Mama Shelter est d’abord un restaurant branché avant d’être un hôtel. Il y a beaucoup de bruit dans le petit hall avec le restaurant juste à côté. Le parking est attribué aussi aux clients du restaurant, un soir plus de place … de la chambre nous pouvions entendre les annonces sonores de la gare. Climatisation HS! Pas de gel douche mais un savon solide, pas facile pour les cheveux. Personnel très jeune, sympathique mais pas assez professionnel, le look est très particulier. Petit déjeuner bien mais pas extraordinaire. Un gros bémol sur la vitrine de l’accueil qui comporte les mêmes articles que l’on peut trouver dans le quartier chaud de Paris …  c’est gênant avec des enfants ou ados ! Peut-être un concept qui correspond à un type de clientèle mais pas à tout le monde, le tout c’est de le savoir.

Nous sortons du restaurant.  Nous avons attendu 25 minutes avant que l on nous prenne la commande des apéritifs. Les serveurs bien que très nombreux sont peu attentifs.  Le responsable de salle inexistant.  La cuisine ouverte nous a permis de voir les cuisiniers qui s amusaient bien en fin de service.  Ils embalaient l une d entre eu dans du papier selofane. Le welsh fût bon. Les sorbets sont bourrés de copeaux de glace car les quenelles sont préparées à l avance c est désolant pour des sorbets vendus fait maison.  Bref aucun intérêt d aller dîner au mama shelter.

amenities_negative.text: Parking is no more included for bar/restaurant clients and this is ridiculous, especially considering the prices

Restaurant - very bad experience, food was not really bad but it took a looong time the service was a disaster, they forgot the orders, we had to ask them many times to bring a drink or to bring the side dish ( I ate my main dish alone) … and it was a normal Wednesday I cannot imagine how they do when the place is really full

Underneath its cool design I found Mama Shelter a coldhearted hotel. My dog was charged 25 euros but got nothing in return: no dog bed, no water bowl, not a single dog biscuits… A good thing I brought a travel mat for my dog to sleep on because it’s clear that Mama dislikes pooches. I have only one good thing to say about this hotel: great breakfast offer with the best scrambled eggs I ever had. That’s it. All the rest: mèh!

Le Mama Shelter est d’abord un restaurant branché avant d’être un hôtel. Il y a beaucoup de bruit dans le petit hall avec le restaurant juste à côté. Le parking est attribué aussi aux clients du restaurant, un soir plus de place … de la chambre nous pouvions entendre les annonces sonores de la gare. Climatisation HS! Pas de gel douche mais un savon solide, pas facile pour les cheveux. Personnel très jeune, sympathique mais pas assez professionnel, le look est très particulier. Petit déjeuner bien mais pas extraordinaire. Un gros bémol sur la vitrine de l’accueil qui comporte les mêmes articles que l’on peut trouver dans le quartier chaud de Paris …  c’est gênant avec des enfants ou ados ! Peut-être un concept qui correspond à un type de clientèle mais pas à tout le monde, le tout c’est de le savoir.

Nous sortons du restaurant.  Nous avons attendu 25 minutes avant que l on nous prenne la commande des apéritifs. Les serveurs bien que très nombreux sont peu attentifs.  Le responsable de salle inexistant.  La cuisine ouverte nous a permis de voir les cuisiniers qui s amusaient bien en fin de service.  Ils embalaient l une d entre eu dans du papier selofane. Le welsh fût bon. Les sorbets sont bourrés de copeaux de glace car les quenelles sont préparées à l avance c est désolant pour des sorbets vendus fait maison.  Bref aucun intérêt d aller dîner au mama shelter.

location_positive.text: Nous rentrons d'un citytrip au Luxembourg.  Cet hôtel est une "pépite" ❤️ Sa décoration, son ambiance feutrée et colorée, sa situation proche du centre-ville accessible par le métro gratuit, son restaurant animé d'écrans et de musique 🎵 et son parking privé font de ce lieu un site incontournable pour un week-end hors du commun. Je le recommande chaleureusement.

⭐️⭐️⭐️✨ (3.5/5)

Mama Shelter Lille is a vibrant and lively hotel that really captures the fun, playful spirit the brand is known for. The XXL room we stayed in was impressively spacious — stylishly designed with modern touches, cozy bedding, and plenty of room to relax. The location is another huge plus, perfectly situated near the train station and the city center, making it easy to explore Lille on foot. The breakfast was also a highlight — fresh, plentiful, and full of variety, from pastries and fruit to hot dishes and great coffee.

However, while the overall atmosphere was enjoyable, a few key issues made the stay less comfortable than it could have been. When the room experienced a blackout and power trip, the recovery process was disappointingly slow. It took quite some time before the issue was addressed, largely because there didn’t seem to be any technical staff on-site to handle it promptly. This was frustrating, especially given the level of service one would expect from a well-known hotel brand.

The air conditioning was another letdown. It barely seemed to work, leaving the room uncomfortably warm and stuffy, particularly during the night. Even with the windows open, there wasn’t enough ventilation to cool the space down properly, which made sleeping difficult.

Overall, Mama Shelter Lille has the potential to be an excellent stay — the design is modern and fun, the food is great, and the location couldn’t be better. But the lack of technical support and weak air conditioning really affected the comfort level. With a bit more attention to maintenance and faster problem-solving, it could easily go from good to great. As it stands, it’s a stylish and convenient hotel with charm — but one that still needs a bit more substance behind the style

Première fois dans le restaurant de Mama Shelter ! Et quelle expérience ! Le cadre est tout juste incroyable, le repas accessible et surprenant ( j'ai beaucoup aimé la proposition de carpaccio de Veau 😋)
Le personnel très sympathique, de la personne qui nous a guidé à notre table ( j'ai oublié son prénom 😅) à Lilly qui s'est occupé de nous pour le repas!

Nous y retournerons ! 🤩

Très bien situé à 5 minutes du tramway, pratique surtout que les transports sont t totalement gratuit
L'hôtel sympa avec une décoration originale, le
Personnel est très accueillant et serviable
Hotel with uniquely decorated interior in good location. Tasty breakfast and polite staff.

wifi_positive.text: Très bon hôtel, avec un concept qui change.  Petit dej excellent et je vous invite à découvrir les services et la boutique sur leur site internet

A quirky hotel in Luxembourg.
The hotel is situated in the new part of the city but it has very good transport connections. Or you can just walk. The rooms are good with all the necessary amenities. There is a bakery downstairs with good selection. Staff is friendly.

Tres bien, manque de minu dentifrice et de produits pour les cheveux.

Et matelas pas assez ferme

Sinon très propre, calme, bon wifi et SDB fonctionnelle

Tree belle vue depuis le restaurant

Petit dej très sympa

Staff charmant

It was all good! Nice people, good atmosphere/ambiance, good food. Cost free public transport to city center is great and very nearby.
Only point of improvement: make it possible to make a cup of coffee in the room.

The stay was very nice, and the room was great, but I would prefer USB charge option in room. USB is a standard any most hotels.

Also the rooftop bar needs a serious inspection. It smells of cold, and water was leaking form the roof at several areas in the bar. Once, a drop from the roof, went directly into my wine. I left at that point. The air is overly humid due to poor drainage from the roof, which is slatted and opens. It probably needs maintenance. I notice both bartenders had a wet cough, indicating the air quality is unhealthy. If the smell of wet towels in the back of a car on a hot summer day, did not give the problem away. I feel the employees are used to the smell, but several people commented on the same.

P.S. If you want evidence of the water drainage problems. Look at the security camera overlooking the bar. It is covered in red algae, and has water directly flowing over it to the bar floor.

Best regards,

Nous avons passé deux nuits au Mama Shelter de Lille. Première fois pour nous dans un des hôtels de cette chaîne et nous sommes très agréablement surpris.
Des beaux locaux, une literie incroyable, des petites attentions dans la chambre à notre arrivée. Le petit déjeuné et très bons et le tartare de thon d’une grande douceur. Le personnel est très à l’écoute mais je tenais à souligner particulièrement le travail et la gentillesse d’Agnès. Encore merci à elle pour tout et à toute l’équipe. See you later! #TeamAgnes #GoodVibesOnly #MamaGang
Great hotel with helpful staff, nice rooms, excellent breakfast. The atmosphere is special.

noise_neutral.text: Quirky hotel, with great food and good bar, DJs in the evening when we stayed. Quiet rooms overlooking the city - clean, welcoming staff. Nice atmosphere. Beds comfy and nice bathrooms. Good for the price.

Nice hotel well located for business stay.  Easy to access city center with free tram.  We appreciated the quietness and nice boulangerie.
However after 4 days we still haven’t received the reimbursement of the check in deposit of €100… 
I don’t understand why it’s not done during check out and handover a copy of the cancellation charges…
It was too crowded and very loud. It took us 30 minutes to get out drinks after ordering. Overall ambiance was good, so no complaints.
It's a beautiful hotel, modern and clean. Unfortunately, the rooms aren't soundproof; lots of noise all night from the bar/restaurant on the ground floor.

Second time at this hotel for a business trip. The beds are comfortable but the rooms are either too hot or too noisy.  Apart from one little carton on arrival, no water provided. No coffee / kettle in the room. (Tip: Buy a big bottle from the supermarket and put it in the fridge).

Breakfast is a bit disappointing for the price. (Tip: Go to one of the cafes nearby instead).

The bar can be very loud and getting served takes a while, but the decor and surroundings is very nice.

Both times the roof terrace has been closed.

The staff is always very good. Always nice to see the same, friendly faces.

Having stayed in a few other Lisbon hotels, I would take Mama Shelter but it's not the Mama experience of other cities.

service_negative.text: Restaurant - very bad experience, food was not really bad but it took a looong time the service was a disaster, they forgot the orders, we had to ask them many times to bring a drink or to bring the side dish ( I ate my main dish alone) … and it was a normal Wednesday I cannot imagine how they do when the place is really full

Nous sortons du restaurant.  Nous avons attendu 25 minutes avant que l on nous prenne la commande des apéritifs. Les serveurs bien que très nombreux sont peu attentifs.  Le responsable de salle inexistant.  La cuisine ouverte nous a permis de voir les cuisiniers qui s amusaient bien en fin de service.  Ils embalaient l une d entre eu dans du papier selofane. Le welsh fût bon. Les sorbets sont bourrés de copeaux de glace car les quenelles sont préparées à l avance c est désolant pour des sorbets vendus fait maison.  Bref aucun intérêt d aller dîner au mama shelter.

Ich war schon mal da und da war der Brunch super. Ich bin Vegetarierin, meine Schwester hat eine Nussallergie. Leider muss ich zugeben, dass wir heute erst um 14.30 Uhr reserviert hatten. Und als wir kamen, war das Essen, die warmen Speisen, halt auch nicht mehr so warm. Die Schilder wurden teilweise schon abgeräumt, sodass man nicht mehr genau wusste, was im Essen war. Es gibt auch gar keine Allergene, die angezeigt wurden. Man muss alles extra jeweils immer nachfragen und sogar da war die Servicekraft sich nicht sicher. Für mich gab es nicht mal was Vegetarisches mehr, außer verschiedene kalte Speisen. Es wurde auch keine neue Pizza mehr gemacht. Als wir ankamen, lag da anderthalb Pizza mit Speck. Bis um 16.00 Uhr wurde da nichts erneuert. Was sehr schade war, weil ich finde, wenn man bis 16.00 Uhr Brunch anbietet, muss man halt auch garantieren, dass die Leute immer noch für den gleichen Preis auch das gleiche Essen bekommen als eine Stunde davor. Oder man muss halt dann auch mit dem Preis runtergehen, wenn man dann schon abbauen möchte und kein neues Essen zubereiten möchte. Was ich sehr schade fand und auch viel zu teuer für 53 Euro, halt mit der Auswahl, die wir als Vegetarier hatten.

Is it a night club or a hotel? You better avoid it if you look for a good sleep after a busy day.  As many would choose or have booked the hotel due to its vicinity with the Institutes in the area but in vein..loud music is played and can be felt everywhere. The excuse..there was a karaoke night (guess what.. not everyone checks the hotel website for events or books through it). Which seems the case every other day. They brought earplugs but still the bass was audible. They sell amenities if you happen to forget anythings which is another oddity-these are usually free in other places. On the other hand rooms are clean if this makes things a bit better. And staff are helfull and kind.

Très mauvais accueil à la réception : plus de 20 minutes d attente ! Une personne a l accueil à l heure des arrivées ? Suivi d un accueil froid au restaurant. Service sans sourires...on semble se soucier peu du client !

pricing_positive.text:
It was all good! Nice people, good atmosphere/ambiance, good food. Cost free public transport to city center is great and very nearby.
Only point of improvement: make it possible to make a cup of coffee in the room.

it is a great hotel with a very unique and trendy decoration style!
Has great quality of breakfast and the restaurant is also super good!
the location is 5 minutes from the center!
Parking unfortunately is not free and an overnight stay costs 35 euros even for a resident... so keep that in mind

Hemos estado unos días en familia, y encantados, la habitación estupenda, estábamos 4 personas, y súper amplia y limpia, la decoración del hotel es muy chula, la cafetería que tienen abajo, tiene horno, y hacen la bollería que esta  de cine, las hamburguesas de la terraza del ático, muy ricas, el hospedaje no nos costó mucho, comer y beber en Luxemburgo, ya cada uno que piense lo que quiera, pero barato no es 🤷🏻‍♂️😂😂, nota para el hotel de 10, el transporte publico en la puerta del hotel prácticamente, y funciona muy bien, y es gratuito para residentes y turistas
The hotel is brand new, rooms are nice and cosy, public transports, services and attractions are easy to reach and the MAMA BOULANGERIE is amazing. Great value for money in Luxembourg city.
We had a great stay. Really friendly staff and a good (bit pricey) breakfast. Liked the rooftop bar as well. Good vibes all around :)

room_quality_negative.text: Underneath its cool design I found Mama Shelter a coldhearted hotel. My dog was charged 25 euros but got nothing in return: no dog bed, no water bowl, not a single dog biscuits… A good thing I brought a travel mat for my dog to sleep on because it’s clear that Mama dislikes pooches. I have only one good thing to say about this hotel: great breakfast offer with the best scrambled eggs I ever had. That’s it. All the rest: mèh!

I spent a night following a flight cancellation. My room was on top of a DJ set and I couldn't sleep until 2.30 am due to the noise. The restaurant was pretentious but not good, the pea purée was just butter, I asked for the filet of my fish to be raised and got a poorly done filet full of bones. Finally, when I was supposed to use my voucher for breakfast, this was not possible to do so because the voucher despite mentioning breakfast did not cover the breakfast sum. On top of it, I was told that I needed to get a print of my card but instead, It was a full sum of money taken which made me pay fees with my Amex. To avoid.

As many would choose or have booked the hotel due to its vicinity with the Institutes in the area but in vein..loud music is played and can be felt everywhere. The excuse..there was a karaoke night (guess what.. not everyone checks the hotel website for events or books through it). Which seems the case every other day. They brought earplugs but still the bass was audible. They sell amenities if you happen to forget anythings which is another oddity-these are usually free in other places. On the other hand rooms are clean if this makes things a bit better. And staff are helfull and kind.

Horrible place. I stayed here 2 nights. First night : I could hear my neighbors talking as if I was having a conversation with them. Second night : my room was on the 1st floor, and on the ground floor there was a karakoke at full volume, which of course I could hear very, very well. Went to complain at midnight, the restaurant manager said "I can't do anything, it's the first wednesday of the month, it will stop only at 12.30".

Es la segunda y última vez que me hospedo en este hotel. El lugar es moderno, con una decoración divertida y con estilo, pero el servicio deja mucho que desear. Intentan proyectar una imagen actual y desenfadada, pero luego se dirigen a ti constantemente con un formal “señor”, lo cual rompe completamente esa idea.
A las 14:30, que eran las 15:30 para mi y sin comer aún,  me atendió un chico muy amable que estaba empezando, acompañado por una recepcionista llamada Raquel, que le iba indicando qué hacer. Tuve que esperar unos diez minutos para algo que normalmente se resuelve en uno. Finalmente, tuve que decir: “¿Podrías darme la llave y continuar después con la explicación al chico nuevo ?” — y su respuesta fue de muy malas maneras, prácticamente me lanzó la llave.

En dos ocasiones fui a recepción para hacer consultas y no había nadie disponible.

La habitación, aunque bonita y bien decorada, resulta pequeña, y el servicio en general se siente frío y poco atento.

Because of loud noises at night, I couldn’t sleep well for 3 nights, and as a result, I’ve been having bad migraine that ruined my stay in Lisbon.
As a result, I spent most of my time in bed and I was charged 15€ for late check-out (less than one hour). I also don’t recommend food on the rooftop. The drinks menu was very limited. The restaurant downstairs was alright.
The staff at the reception was slow. They were more concerned about their personal things rather on customer experience.

We have booked this hotel to celebrate our special anniversary for 5 nights. We are not even on the first night that the hotel is WAY TOO noisy. The rooftop is nice but don’t need to go to the rooftop as the music will be the same from your room. We called the reception 3 times and a lady called Ana said she will check with her manager and nothing has been done. We went back to speak with the manager who had no clue about our complain. What kind of service is this. Then, they suggested changing rooms but gave us a lower category. Lisbon is an amazing city with full of hotels, pass this one and have a nicer time somewhere else. Thank you Mama Shelter for ruining our trip.

wifi_neutral.text: Emplazamiento en plena zona de negocios, confortable, simpático y moderno, habitaciones bien insonorizadas, buen wifi.

Expérience mitigée.
Notre arrivée s’est déroulée normalement, les personnes de l’accueil ont été sympathiques.
En revanche, la suite du séjour n’était ni mémorable ni vraiment positive.
Nous avions droit à un cocktail offert, le barman a été aimable mais les tables n’étaient pas débarrassées et sales. C’était vraiment surprenant et désagréable. Alors oui, la vue est magnifique mais pas au point d’avoir envie de se poser sur une table pas débarrassée ou une pleine de traces et qui colle.
Nous étions au 13e étage (donc juste en dessous du bar/rooftop) et au retour de notre soirée, nous avons eu la désagréable surprise d’entendre la musique et les basses dans notre chambre.
Je regarde sur internet et voit que le bar est ouvert jusqu’à 1h du matin donc je me dis que je ne vais pas appeler la réception et attendre que ça s’arrête. Et bien, ça a fini par s’arrêter mais à 2h passées. La nuit a donc été courte et je ne paie pas un hôtel pour ne pas pouvoir y dormir.
Le lendemain matin, nous montons au restaurant du 14e pour le petit déjeuner.
À notre arrivée, nous avons eu l’impression d’être des chiens dans un jeu de quilles. Nous attendons quelques minutes que quelqu’un vienne nous voir pour nous expliquer le fonctionnement, tout le personnel fait comme si nous étions transparentes. Je finis par aller voir quelqu’un à l’autre bout de la salle et on me répond d’aller voir la manager. Nous avons essayé à 3 reprises, elle a systématiquement fait comme si elle ne nous voyait pas faire signe.
Nous avons fini par aller de nous même nous assoir à une table (sale encore) que nous avons dû débarrasser nous mêmes.
Ensuite, rien n’était fluide. Plus d’œufs brouillés pendant plus de 15 minutes, beaucoup de contenants vides, bref, à 10h10, on avait l’impression qu’il aurait fallu choisir un autre créneau pour espérer avoir tout ce qu’il faut, sans attendre.
Bref, je ne reviendrai pas séjourner au Mamma Shelter et je ne le recommande pas du tout.

location_negative.text: Not very friendly staff to say the least. Hefty deposit up front when room already had been paid for. Very small rooms. Good location.

noise_positive.text: We are so grateful a friend recommended Mama Shelter Lisboa! We had a blast of the rooftop listening to Max the DJ. The hotel is beautiful and close to the train station. The people running the front desk are so helpful and kind! Mama Shelter is clean, quiet and walking distance to many great restaurants. Highly recommend - you’ll enjoy your stay!

The location isn't great if you want to get around on foot, but if you're happy to spend a lot of time in taxis, this may not bother you. Restaurant etc overpriced, so I didn't eat there. The rooms were quiet (as long as you turned off the aircon to sleep), and the beds were SOOOOO COMFORTABLE!

I wouldn't personally stay again, but I would LIVE in those beds.

I enjoyed my stay here. The location is incredible, very central so perfect for exploring Lisbon. My room was nice and felt very safe - the bed was comfortable and the air con kept the room cool in the heat. Only minor issue in my room (410) was the tap over the sink - it didn’t seem to be secured properly to the wall and is far too close to the sink so you can’t really get your hands under it. There are no irons / steamers in the rooms, I asked reception on three separate occasions for one and they were never able to give me one as they said they were being used by other guests. The room was quiet, I genuinely didn’t hear any noise from the restaurant or the roof top bar and I stayed Friday - Monday (on the 4th floor).

Le brunch est un moment festif que tout un chacun devrait tester en famille.
Petits et grands y trouvent leur compte.
Le buffet est exceptionnel.
Viennoiseries
Café et thé
Pains de plusieurs sortes dont un brun avec des raisins secs, une pure merveille.
Une multitude de petites entrées: œufs mayonnaise, poivrons confits, cœurs d’artichauts marinés a l’huile ( succulent)etc……
Viandes diverses et accompagnements élaborés et soignés.
Quand aux desserts, oubliez vos poignées d’amour, je recommande une petite merveille, les cannelés, un pousse au crime (attention la quantité est limitée et les amateurs le savent.)
Le rapport qualité/prix est excellent

Quand à nos moutards une équipe dédiée s’en occupe.

À visiter d’urgence

We stayed here for one night on a short city trip to Paris. I had stayed here before and enjoyed the experience. Great views of the city from the rooftop bar and restaurant. Cool and relaxed atmosphere, quiet. Located not too far from the metro lines.

wifi_negative.text:
AC in the room didn’t work and it was incredibly hot. Normally, I’m not the sensitive but it was extreme to the level of disrupting sleep. We called the front desk and they said they’d call us back.

The next day they told us there was no maintenance in the evenings. There was no way they did not know it was already broken. Since the windows don’t open much and there are no fans, it was pretty horrible.

Also the WiFi didn’t work in the room so no connecting to the TV in the living room and the bedroom TV didn’t work.
Chambre 505, pas de climatisation, pas d'internet, service désagréable au rooftop car débordé, je venais souvent n'y viendrai plus. Ceva Logistics.

community_negative.text:
Resumindo, foi a pior experiência que já tive num restaurante em toda a minha vida. Vamos lá aos factos…

Era o aniversário da minha namorada, o que supostamente era para ser uma comemoração feliz e incrível com os nossos amigos. Ela havia escolhido o lugar pois ela já conhecia o Mama Shelter de outros sítios e, por gostar da vibe, imaginou que seria a mesma coisa aqui em Lisboa.

O responsável pela loja naquela noite era o Fábio, que fez um comunicado desagradável e tendenciosamente arrogante ao meio da mesa, enquanto alguns dos nossos amigos estavam a fazer as suas refeições e a tomar os seus drinks, com o foco numa mensagem do tipo:
“Para mantermos a mesa aqui, todos têm que consumir no mínimo 28€. Se todos não forem comer, acaba por não compensar”, e coisas do género…

Como podem imaginar, por si só já foi extremamente desconfortável e frustrante, porque uma coisa é certa: não éramos todos que íamos comer ali, e visto que cada drink ali ronda os 15€ em média, não há dúvida de que a mesa ultrapassaria facilmente o valor de consumo por pessoa.
O que claramente não foi feito devido a este aviso desconfortável e à falta de preparação tanto do Mama Shelter como estabelecimento, quanto dos seus funcionários. Claramente o Fábio deve ter feito o que lhe foi instruído, porém essa está longe de ser a forma correcta de lidar com o cliente final.

Eu e mais dois amigos fomos ter com ele, longe da mesa e dos restantes convidados, a fim de resolver a situação. No final, ficou resolvida, não tivemos de sair, mas certamente fez com que a nossa noite ficasse ali, estragada e manchada por ele.

Pretendo não voltar a este restaurante nunca mais, e recomendo que, antes de fecharem qualquer coisa a nível digital, liguem e esclareçam todas as dúvidas, porque em nenhum momento, até ao aviso desagradável do Fábio, foi-nos informado que cada pessoa teria de consumir pelo menos 28€ — o que, aliás, não seria problema para nenhum de nós.

A única coisa que tive de deixar inicialmente — e que foi muito bem avisada — foi colocar os dados do cartão de crédito para assegurar 120€, caso não desmarcasse a tempo, o que é totalmente justo.

Sobre o estabelecimento: é muito barulhento, mesas demasiado próximas, climatização aquém, atendimento péssimo, decoração razoável — uma experiência digna de 1ou 2 estrela no máximo.

Se quiserem experimentar, não recomendo. Mas tirem as vossas próprias conclusões.

À equipa do Mama Shelter.

location_positive.text: The space itself is amazing and in a great location. Unfortunately, I had a strange interaction with a bartender that made the experience less enjoyable. Despite clearly waiting for quite a while, I was repeatedly skipped over when trying to order — three times in a row — in a way that felt personal. I was also the only person of color at the bar at the time, which made the situation feel even more pointed. Eventually, another guest had to speak up on my behalf, and the bartender seemed surprised to learn I was a member. What could have been an otherwise wonderful night was dampened by that interaction.

The staff was superb and really helped me with a room issue. The location and interiors are right on point for SoHo House. I really enjoyed my stay and looking forward to coming back again multiple times already 👌

I had an absolutely wonderful stay at Soho Amsterdam Hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city. From the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the warm and welcoming atmosphere created by the friendly staff. They were attentive, professional, and eager to assist with any questions or requests, which made me feel truly valued as a guest.

The hotel's location is fantastic—situated in the heart of Amsterdam, it offers easy access to many of the city's major attractions, charming neighborhoods, and vibrant nightlife. Exploring the city was a breeze, thanks to the convenient transportation options nearby.

My room was spacious, modern, and beautifully decorated, providing a perfect retreat after a day of sightseeing. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring restful nights, and the amenities, including high-speed Wi-Fi and a well-stocked minibar, added to the comfort of my stay.

One of the highlights was the hotel’s stylish lounge and bar area, which was perfect for unwinding with a drink after a busy day. The ambiance was chic yet cozy, making it an ideal spot to relax.

Breakfast at the hotel was delightful—offering a variety of fresh, high-quality options that catered to different tastes. The staff at the restaurant were attentive and friendly, contributing to a pleasant start to each day.

Overall, my experience at Soho Amsterdam Hotel exceeded my expectations. The combination of excellent service, comfortable accommodations, and prime location makes it a top choice for anyone visiting Amsterdam. I look forward to returning on my next trip!

Vibrant place where all the +ve energy flows! A meet place for all bright minds with innovative ideas who meet to disrupt the existing business model and complete transformation. Love the bar and easy sit out place and the hustle and bustl around the place. Good location in heart of soho

Amazing hotel in Amsterdam, close to enough to walk to everything you might want to see in the centre of Amsterdam whilst still being lovely and quiet to stay in. Rooms are impeccable and all amenities you could need provided - toiletries to electricals, refreshments to full mini bar. All staff we spoke with were very helpful and friendly, from reception to the bar, and the pool, we never felt like a bother. We stayed during June heatwave so the pool was very busy, if you want to be lazy there on a sunny day (the drinks and food are lovely up there too) I recommend going up early or booking a cabana with the reception team when you check in. We arrived early and left our bags with reception who kindly gave us a water each and called us around 1 hour early to say the room was ready. We look forward to future house stays around the world.

Unbelievable stay at the SoHo Amsterdam. We loved every aspect of our time there— the amenities, service, and all the little touches. It’s gorgeous and has everything you’d need for a stay in Amsterdam. The room service was amazing, the gym had everything you could possibly need, and the rooftop was gorgeous and the perfect place to take in views of the city. SoHo is a bit on the exclusive side, and does require membership for access. I’d advise to go with the friend membership, if you’re just wanting to try it out. They have locations all around the globe. Would highly recommend if you’re looking for something on the high end!

pricing_neutral.text: The rooftop pool with its views are quite cool, but other than that, there doesn't seem like much to shout about. The food was pricey and lacked nutritional value.

It's disappointing that this house is closed on Sundays. We're also alarmed that your other houses are banning laptops after 12 pm, which means those people pushed out of the 180 house, and other houses are now overflowing the Dean house to be able to use their computers, creating overcrowding, so the 180 can increase revenue with food/beverages. Also, increasing the tip amount to 14.5% is wild, (this isn't the U.S.), especially since the menu prices are market prices, on top of the 255 monthly fee, and service, although super friendly and nice, is so slow, our coffees are consistently cold by the time they make it to us (cocktails with ice melting). We pay you enough for you to pay your employees without also putting that on members. It's obviously a gorgeous house that most of us love, but we're concerned about this direction.

Soho House is very hit or miss. Usually come here for the Cinema which is more cosy than standard vue or odeon ect.

We ordered food at the restaurant and two of us got the Sirloin Steak with Fries  which was cheaper than the ribeye but it was nothing special and quite small. Gone in a few bites. My friend got the Trout which was much better and well portioned. It didn't come with any sides so my friend also got fries.

Desert was my first Monkey Bread which was quite morish but the banana ice cream had a tart after taste which was a shame as it needed the cold element.

Got a few cocktails and over all they were just ok, nothing special (As a Bartender had better)

Stayed here for four nights with some friends while I was visiting Amsterdam for the first time. We had a Medium room and it was a nice stay (you don’t have a SoHo House membership to stay here). We had a king sized bed and pull out mattress (that’s an extra cost per night). The mini bar is stocked with a lot of liquors and free chocolate chip cookies. The tea set is really cute and the art is aesthetic. There is a restaurant on the rooftop as well as a pool. The gym is well-equipped and they have fitness classes as well. I liked that the bathrooms came supplied with a lot of different options for shampoos, conditioners, and body wash. The location is good and it’s a doable walk to the Centraal Station.

We did have an issue with some of the staff members not being helpful or blatantly disinterested in helping.  There was a lack of clarity in how many people they allow in hotel rooms (i.e.3 people have to book a medium size room and can’t book a smaller one). The forced upgrade left a bit of a sour taste in my mouth.

food_beverage_neutral.text: The rooftop pool with its views are quite cool, but other than that, there doesn't seem like much to shout about. The food was pricey and lacked nutritional value.

It's disappointing that this house is closed on Sundays. We're also alarmed that your other houses are banning laptops after 12 pm, which means those people pushed out of the 180 house, and other houses are now overflowing the Dean house to be able to use their computers, creating overcrowding, so the 180 can increase revenue with food/beverages. Also, increasing the tip amount to 14.5% is wild, (this isn't the U.S.), especially since the menu prices are market prices, on top of the 255 monthly fee, and service, although super friendly and nice, is so slow, our coffees are consistently cold by the time they make it to us (cocktails with ice melting). We pay you enough for you to pay your employees without also putting that on members. It's obviously a gorgeous house that most of us love, but we're concerned about this direction.

Soho House is very hit or miss. Usually come here for the Cinema which is more cosy than standard vue or odeon ect.

We ordered food at the restaurant and two of us got the Sirloin Steak with Fries  which was cheaper than the ribeye but it was nothing special and quite small. Gone in a few bites. Got a few cocktails and over all they were just ok, nothing special (As a Bartender had better)

Slept brilliantly in cosy plus room on second floor. Loved the 5th floor lounge for chilling with a pot of tea in the afternoon and the sunny rooftop terrace was wonderful ( pool not open yet). Staff really looked after us - organising taxi back to airport and such a great check in experience. Wonderful recommendation to a private tour of Van Gogh museum with Amsterdam experiences and the guide picked us up from hotel - short tram ride to museum. We loved the nearby quirky shopping, the Dave boat tour was fabulous ( so entertaining) and the secret garden restaurant which was an easy walk away was our other favourite .  Will definitely return here especially as you can pack so light ( to leave room for shopping !) as the rooms have everything from conditioner to deodorant and adapters.
