wifi_positive.text:
I had an absolutely wonderful stay at Soho Amsterdam Hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city. From the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the warm and welcoming atmosphere created by the friendly staff. They were attentive, professional, and eager to assist with any questions or requests, which made me feel truly valued as a guest.

The hotel's location is fantastic—situated in the heart of Amsterdam, it offers easy access to many of the city's major attractions, charming neighborhoods, and vibrant nightlife. Exploring the city was a breeze, thanks to the convenient transportation options nearby.

My room was spacious, modern, and beautifully decorated, providing a perfect retreat after a day of sightseeing. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring restful nights, and the amenities, including high-speed Wi-Fi and a well-stocked minibar, added to the comfort of my stay.

One of the highlights was the hotel’s stylish lounge and bar area, which was perfect for unwinding with a drink after a busy day. The ambiance was chic yet cozy, making it an ideal spot to relax.

Breakfast at the hotel was delightful—offering a variety of fresh, high-quality options that catered to different tastes. The staff at the restaurant were attentive and friendly, contributing to a pleasant start to each day.

Overall, my experience at Soho Amsterdam Hotel exceeded my expectations. The combination of excellent service, comfortable accommodations, and prime location makes it a top choice for anyone visiting Amsterdam. I look forward to returning on my next trip!

The Soho House in Berlin is definitely one of the better spots in Europe. It’s beautifully located, comes with a cocktail bartender (as it should), and the food is above average. The staff? Surprisingly friendly! But let’s not forget, this is still a German establishment, so don’t expect the kind of service you’d get in, say, the U.S. or Italy—manage those expectations accordingly. For me, it’s a fantastic place to connect with other creatives, network, and brainstorm fresh ideas—preferably over a well-made drink.

noise_positive.text: Amazing hotel in Amsterdam, close to enough to walk to everything you might want to see in the centre of Amsterdam whilst still being lovely and quiet to stay in. Rooms are impeccable and all amenities you could need provided - toiletries to electricals, refreshments to full mini bar. All staff we spoke with were very helpful and friendly, from reception to the bar, and the pool, we never felt like a bother. We stayed during June heatwave so the pool was very busy, if you want to be lazy there on a sunny day (the drinks and food are lovely up there too) I recommend going up early or booking a cabana with the reception team when you check in. We arrived early and left our bags with reception who kindly gave us a water each and called us around 1 hour early to say the room was ready. We look forward to future house stays around the world.

Despite the reviews, I think it’s still the best steak and frites in town - with the tasty peppercorn sauce. Always love it when it’s quiet here and you get the entire room to yourself, with a pint of Guinness. Great staff and service.. still one of my favourite private members club in London, specifically this venue.
Attended a meeting as a guest of a member, quiet, clean and productive space, impressive service.
One of my favorite Soho Houses in London. It's quiet and pleasant. The food is very good.

I had brunch with my friends in the members-only area. The service was excellent; the staff were friendly and accommodating. Although it was a bit noisy and crowded on the weekend, the vibrant atmosphere and the pleasant interior made it enjoyable. The food was just okay, but overall we had a great time.

food_beverage_negative.text: DISASTER! Poor food quality, amenities always broken (sauna and gym equipment) and mold in the showers. Want to stop my membership but absolutely impossible. To stop my membership I physically went there 4 times, multiple e-mails and phone calls and filled out an online form to resign; guess what: they just charged my bank with the annual fee.

Actual member here. Transferred my membership from an NYC house when I moved a few months ago. Excitement about the Amsterdam house quickly turned into disappointment. In the process of resigning my membership now. I'm likely spoiled by the NYC and LA houses but the Amsterdam location doesn't even come remotely close to those houses. It's boring, pretentious, and most importantly it's not even exclusive which is kind of the point of being a member here.

It doubles as a hotel which totally negates the exclusivity portion. I knew I was done here when I saw little kids running around the blue and canal rooms. Weird hotel guests are always popping their heads into rooms and taking up space in the lounge area upstairs. Supposedly they're not allowed in the gym but I doubt anyone actually stops them.

Also, one of the staff members was incredibly rude to my guests. I left them in the restaurant for a few minutes to run downstairs and some girl in the restaurant took it as an opportunity to "card" them - when they told her they werent members but with a member she threatened to kick them out and told them she needed to escort them out immediately. And no, they weren't doing anything wrong. They weren't loud. They weren't violating house rules. Nothing. They were sitting at a table, eating with their laptops out. That's it. And no, it wasn't outside of "laptop hours".

They reiterated that they were with a member and reminded her that she actually saw me. Unfortunately, my friends didn't tell me any of this until after the fact bc they knew I would've ripped that girl to pieces if Id known how rude she was to them in real time.

It's just not worth paying for what I could easily get at any 3 star hotel lobby. Maybe if they build another house for you know... MEMBERS ONLY... I'll consider coming back but as of now it's just a waste.
Worst Soho that I have ever been. Terrible service and a bar without good single malts.

Basically rubbish, I had a lovely evening with my best friend, but they have clearly over expanded and the vibe is barely better than a Yates wine lodge, indefensibly the bars are understaffed so the poor bar staff
are horribly over worked and it shows in slow and desperate service. The recent slew of articles questioning the Soho House model are sadly too accurate, it’s too commercial, too busy and ultimately, not exclusive enough.

Why are the waiters so inexperienced here? They got my order wrong then I had to ask the second order to 3 people before I got it. Food was cold by then. Management must be terrible here. Really sad management compared to other houses around the world.

By far the worst Soho House I've been to across the globe. The service is non-existent. I've walked out multiple times after sitting for +15min with no service, or a waiter dropping a menu then never coming back.

If you're becoming a member or staying here for the pool use, think again. It's over-crowded by 9am all summer and absolutely filthy. They don't clean it on mornings after a busy day so be prepared to swim around in nothing but garbage from the day before.

If you're a member so that you can attend the events, their booking system is awful. You can never get tickets to anything (even right when they release) and if you turn up to the events you always see the same handful of people inside. It's clearly not a fair allocations system at all, or whoever runs it is just giving access to friends before anyone else.

Overall this place is not worth coming to, let alone the high membership fee associated unless you want to use it for the other houses globally

cleanliness_positive.text: I loveeeeee this hotel. I didn’t want to leave! The staff is incredibly kind and welcoming, they have beautiful candles, plus the hotel robe and toiletries for purchase, and the rooms are pretty and clean. My parents had a huge bathtub in their room and my room just had a shower but it was amazing. Obsessed with all the different products in the bathroom and the cozy bed and soft linens. The cookies in the room were a nice touch. Truly did not want to leave. And the hotel is perfectly located in the SoHo area of London as well.
Attended a meeting as a guest of a member, quiet, clean and productive space, impressive service.

Had a fantastic stay in the Amsterdam house over new years. We ate at Cecconi’s and the house restaurant, both served really well cooked and delicious food.

All of the staff were friendly and attentive. Beautiful building with clean and spacious rooms.

Fantastic location too.

Would definitely return!

Rooftop bar around 9 pm was very relaxing! Enjoyed the evening views with a nice picante from the rooftop bar.

Front desk and bartenders were friendly! Clean spaces, bathrooms, etc.

Not the nicest Soho House we have been to (comparing to Dumbo House, Barcelona, etc) but had great views & service!

*Did not stay here. We only stopped in on our delayed flights! So giving a 5-star just from our short time here.

Our stay at the Soho house Berlin was an absolute highlight from start to finish. The location is perfect – Alexanderplatz is 600m and the view from our room was great.

We especially want to highlight the exceptionally friendly and attentive staff, who made us feel welcome at all times. From the reception to housekeeping – everyone was warm, professional, and always ready to help.

The rooms are elegantly furnished, spotlessly clean, and offer the highest level of comfort.

Their soho house welcome cookies were delicious.

We will definitely be back!

community_negative.text: App and google said open on bank holiday Monday but it was closed. Several people outside trying to get in. Crazy

Applied 3 years ago, ghosted and no response on status, then when I was too old for the initial u27 package they emailed me with a "sorry we ignored you for so long" and then trying to sell me a membership. If they treat their community the same way as they treat possbile new members, I'm curious to see how long this brand will last.

Basically rubbish, I had a lovely evening with my best friend, but they have clearly over expanded and the vibe is barely better than a Yates wine lodge, indefensibly the bars are understaffed so the poor bar staff
are horribly over worked and it shows in slow and desperate service. The recent slew of articles questioning the Soho House model are sadly too accurate, it’s too commercial, too busy and ultimately, not exclusive enough.

Why are the waiters so inexperienced here? They got my order wrong then I had to ask the second order to 3 people before I got it. Food was cold by then. Management must be terrible here. Really sad management compared to other houses around the world.

By far the worst Soho House I've been to across the globe. The service is non-existent. I've walked out multiple times after sitting for +15min with no service, or a waiter dropping a menu then never coming back.

If you're becoming a member or staying here for the pool use, think again. It's over-crowded by 9am all summer and absolutely filthy. They don't clean it on mornings after a busy day so be prepared to swim around in nothing but garbage from the day before.

If you're a member so that you can attend the events, their booking system is awful. You can never get tickets to anything (even right when they release) and if you turn up to the events you always see the same handful of people inside. It's clearly not a fair allocations system at all, or whoever runs it is just giving access to friends before anyone else.

Overall this place is not worth coming to, let alone the high membership fee associated unless you want to use it for the other houses globally

room_quality_negative.text:
Ac did not work in the room and it took me asking 5 times before they agreed to change the room 24 hours later.
We had two rooms in the hotel and that did not get me a seat at their movie theatre for neither the first night nor the second night.
The rooftop is overrun with members no seats or tables available on the two days I was here. Do not come. Go to the hoxton or somewhere else where they respect the guests.

Imagine paying 500€ a night and you can’t even get a table at the rooftop or movie theatre.

A waste of time and money. Do not stay here. The service is horrendous.

Rooms are nicely decorated. The rest seems very pretentious. We stayed 4 nights and felt that it was more of a place to been seen by young people who aren't staying at the hotel. We are on a work trip from Australia and the time difference meant we needed to work while having breakfast. The no laptop rule at certain tables is very weird. We were surrounded by people on laptops on the bar and smaller tables but were told we couldn't use ours. We felt like school children. Perhaps they should make it harder for people not staying at the hotel to enter level 5 so the guests paying 600aud a night who aren't there to be seen are able to work quietly.

If you’re planning to stay at Soho House Berlin, I sincerely recommend you don’t leave your room, it’s the only part of the hotel that actually works.

The rooms themselves are beautiful, no complaints there. Everything else, however, is a masterclass in chaos. The reception is unreliable, the tables in the club look like they haven’t seen a cleaning cloth in weeks, and most of the staff seem to have graduated from the “how to be rude 101” training program. With one shining exception, a single girl who was genuinely helpful, everyone else operates on the level of a budget hostel rather than a so-called five-star establishment.

And let’s be clear: laziness cannot be justified by “Soho House values alignment.” It’s not charming, it’s not “community spirit,” and it’s definitely not “cool.” It’s simply unprofessional. That kind of attitude might fly in a place where guests stay for free and staff aren’t being paid, but when I’m paying full price, I expect at least the basics of hospitality.

At some point, I realized I was doing more work than the staff, and when you politely remind them that service is, in fact, their job, they somehow manage to take offense. Quite an experience.

I’ve been a full-price paying member of Soho House Berlin for many years, but sadly it has lost much of its original relevance. The building itself is beautiful, and the Cowshed spa team continues to deliver excellent quality, but beyond that, the experience has declined.

Service is inconsistent at best: staff are often untrained or inattentive, making it unnecessarily difficult to order even a simple drink. Toilets (especially upstairs in summer) are frequently in unacceptable condition, which is disappointing for what is also a hotel. Food quality is a hit-and-miss as well.

Membership value has eroded. There are now large numbers of under-27 members paying half the fee, bringing in several guests and benefiting from extra discounts, which undermines the supposed exclusivity and professional community. Many don’t seem to be in creative industries at all. The “no photo / no call” policy is no longer enforced, so the space feels more like a backdrop for selfies than a members’ club.

I’ve raised these issues with membership managers over the years, they acknowledged service and community challenges, but nothing changed. Ironically, I only received a follow-up call once my membership cancellation had already gone through.

Soho House Berlin still has the potential to be special, but as it stands, the standards have slipped too far. The spa team deserves recognition for maintaining quality, but the rest of the House needs serious attention.

service_negative.text:
Ac did not work in the room and it took me asking 5 times before they agreed to change the room 24 hours later.
We had two rooms in the hotel and that did not get me a seat at their movie theatre for neither the first night nor the second night.
The rooftop is overrun with members no seats or tables available on the two days I was here. Do not come. Go to the hoxton or somewhere else where they respect the guests.

Imagine paying 500€ a night and you can’t even get a table at the rooftop or movie theatre.

A waste of time and money. Do not stay here. The service is horrendous.

Actual member here. Transferred my membership from an NYC house when I moved a few months ago. Excitement about the Amsterdam house quickly turned into disappointment. In the process of resigning my membership now. I'm likely spoiled by the NYC and LA houses but the Amsterdam location doesn't even come remotely close to those houses. It's boring, pretentious, and most importantly it's not even exclusive which is kind of the point of being a member here.

It doubles as a hotel which totally negates the exclusivity portion. I knew I was done here when I saw little kids running around the blue and canal rooms. Weird hotel guests are always popping their heads into rooms and taking up space in the lounge area upstairs. Supposedly they're not allowed in the gym but I doubt anyone actually stops them.

Also, one of the staff members was incredibly rude to my guests. I left them in the restaurant for a few minutes to run downstairs and some girl in the restaurant took it as an opportunity to "card" them - when they told her they werent members but with a member she threatened to kick them out and told them she needed to escort them out immediately. And no, they weren't doing anything wrong. They weren't loud. They weren't violating house rules. Nothing. They were sitting at a table, eating with their laptops out. That's it. And no, it wasn't outside of "laptop hours".

They reiterated that they were with a member and reminded her that she actually saw me. Unfortunately, my friends didn't tell me any of this until after the fact bc they knew I would've ripped that girl to pieces if Id known how rude she was to them in real time.

It's just not worth paying for what I could easily get at any 3 star hotel lobby. Maybe if they build another house for you know... MEMBERS ONLY... I'll consider coming back but as of now it's just a waste.

The blonde blue eyed guy that works at the reception has a temper problem, at least that’s what i gathered when he treated me and my friend in an aggressive manner.
Except from that i wish they had a lost & found section for all items they find, instead of throwing missing personal items away.
Worst Soho that I have ever been. Terrible service and a bar without good single malts.

Basically rubbish, I had a lovely evening with my best friend, but they have clearly over expanded and the vibe is barely better than a Yates wine lodge, indefensibly the bars are understaffed so the poor bar staff
are horribly over worked and it shows in slow and desperate service. The recent slew of articles questioning the Soho House model are sadly too accurate, it’s too commercial, too busy and ultimately, not exclusive enough.

Rooms are nicely decorated. The rest seems very pretentious. We stayed 4 nights and felt that it was more of a place to been seen by young people who aren't staying at the hotel. We are on a work trip from Australia and the time difference meant we needed to work while having breakfast. The no laptop rule at certain tables is very weird. We were surrounded by people on laptops on the bar and smaller tables but were told we couldn't use ours. We felt like school children. Perhaps they should make it harder for people not staying at the hotel to enter level 5 so the guests paying 600aud a night who aren't there to be seen are able to work quietly.

Overcrowded, Disorganised, and Lacking Any Atmosphere – What’s the Point?

I visited Soho House Barcelona last week as a guest, and the experience was an absolute joke. The most frustrating part wasn’t even the lack of service—it was the sheer chaos. The place was packed to the brim with people on laptops working anywhere they could find space, including standing up at a chest of drawers outside the toilets. Others were pacing around on calls, and some were even taking business calls inside the photo booth. Is this supposed to be a private members’ club or just a crowded Gen Z co-working space?

The atmosphere was completely lost in the chaos. Finding a comfortable place to sit was impossible unless you arrived ridiculously early, and if you did manage to find a spot, you were wedged between people typing away on laptops or loudly discussing their start-ups. It felt more like a disorganised WeWork than an upmarket social space.

On top of that, the service was nonexistent. I didn’t see a single waiter the entire time, wasn’t offered a menu, and had to bring my own water and food from outside—at a private club with a hefty membership fee.

This isn’t a one-off bad experience; it’s clearly a fundamental problem with how the House is being managed. Given that this is the only Soho House in Barcelona, I know of members who are seriously reconsidering whether their membership is even worth it anymore.

Unless something drastically changes, I wouldn’t recommend Soho House Barcelona to anyone looking for an exclusive, stylish, and relaxing place to socialise. Right now, it’s just an expensive, overcrowded mess.

Join any or all of the London houses if you can, but don’t bother in Barcelona.
Very noise on the street after party even 5AM in the early morning , why here such a hotel?

The sixth Soho House I've been to, but this one disappointed. Cleaning staff made a lot of noise from 3-4 in the morning, other guests were a bit obnoxious and the value didn't seem on par with other locations I've stayed.

By far the worst Soho House I've been to across the globe. The service is non-existent. I've walked out multiple times after sitting for +15min with no service, or a waiter dropping a menu then never coming back.

If you're becoming a member or staying here for the pool use, think again. It's over-crowded by 9am all summer and absolutely filthy. They don't clean it on mornings after a busy day so be prepared to swim around in nothing but garbage from the day before.

You can never get tickets to anything (even right when they release) and if you turn up to the events you always see the same handful of people inside. It's clearly not a fair allocations system at all, or whoever runs it is just giving access to friends before anyone else.

Overall this place is not worth coming to, let alone the high membership fee associated unless you want to use it for the other houses globally

Went to the club and it’s got kind of a confusing layout. Staff are not friendly and don’t answer questions well. As an international traveler visiting this location for the first time I found it overrated and think you’d be better off spending time anywhere else. To be clear I didn’t stay in the hotel, I was just visiting the social club. The only nice thing about it is that it has a really nice view of the Fernsehturm

This place was super disrespectful. It smelled disgustingly of fish when I walked in, I got a coffee and right after sitting down I was asked to leave the section I was in because it was a “member only section”. It wasn’t even that crowded and the woman was a snob about it. Definitely will not be going back here.

Beautiful location, service is horrible.
Arrogant waiters and managers.
Anything you order will arrive late and cold…
Probably the worst Soho house

community_neutral.text: During the day noisy planes fly over and at night they organise partys. Only book a room here if you do not like sleeping. Reception claim they cannot do anything about it, but the rooms are just not soundproof. Frontdesk is pretty arrogant, not nice people to deal with.

It's disappointing that this house is closed on Sundays. We're also alarmed that your other houses are banning laptops after 12 pm, which means those people pushed out of the 180 house, and other houses are now overflowing the Dean house to be able to use their computers, creating overcrowding, so the 180 can increase revenue with food/beverages. Also, increasing the tip amount to 14.5% is wild, (this isn't the U.S.), especially since the menu prices are market prices, on top of the 255 monthly fee, and service, although super friendly and nice, is so slow, our coffees are consistently cold by the time they make it to us (cocktails with ice melting). We pay you enough for you to pay your employees without also putting that on members. It's obviously a gorgeous house that most of us love, but we're concerned about this direction.

Want to report about my experience, there is a blonde guy who works in the reception that treats some people very badly depending on what they look like. He argued with me and raised his voice in the middle of me talking to my friend. He made both of us uncomfortable micromanaging every move we make. He is tal with blue eyes and blonde hair.

Stayed here for four nights with some friends while I was visiting Amsterdam for the first time. We had a Medium room and it was a nice stay (you don’t have a SoHo House membership to stay here). We had a king sized bed and pull out mattress (that’s an extra cost per night). The mini bar is stocked with a lot of liquors and free chocolate chip cookies. The tea set is really cute and the art is aesthetic. There is a restaurant on the rooftop as well as a pool. The gym is well-equipped and they have fitness classes as well. I liked that the bathrooms came supplied with a lot of different options for shampoos, conditioners, and body wash. The location is good and it’s a doable walk to the Centraal Station.

We did have an issue with some of the staff members not being helpful or blatantly disinterested in helping.  There was a lack of clarity in how many people they allow in hotel rooms (i.e.3 people have to book a medium size room and can’t book a smaller one). The forced upgrade left a bit of a sour taste in my mouth.

Soho House is very hit or miss. Usually come here for the Cinema which is more cosy than standard vue or odeon ect.

We ordered food at the restaurant and two of us got the Sirloin Steak with Fries  which was cheaper than the ribeye but it was nothing special and quite small. Gone in a few bites. My friend got the Trout which was much better and well portioned. It didn't come with any sides so my friend also got fries.

Desert was my first Monkey Bread which was quite morish but the banana ice cream had a tart after taste which was a shame as it needed the cold element.

Got a few cocktails and over all they were just ok, nothing special (As a Bartender had better)

He argued with me and raised his voice in the middle of me talking to my friend. He made both of us uncomfortable micromanaging every move we make. He is tal with blue eyes and blonde hair.

Slept brilliantly in cosy plus room on second floor. Loved the 5th floor lounge for chilling with a pot of tea in the afternoon and the sunny rooftop terrace was wonderful ( pool not open yet). Staff really looked after us - organising taxi back to airport and such a great check in experience. Wonderful recommendation to a private tour of Van Gogh museum with Amsterdam experiences and the guide picked us up from hotel - short tram ride to museum. We loved the nearby quirky shopping, the Dave boat tour was fabulous ( so entertaining) and the secret garden restaurant which was an easy walk away was our other favourite .  Will definitely return here especially as you can pack so light ( to leave room for shopping !) as the rooms have everything from conditioner to deodorant and adapters.

Soho House Barcelona provided a delightful escape for us during a midweek stay away from the office. Our arrival in the evening was met with a wonderful dinner, followed by relaxation in the spacious lounge area.||However, the following morning presented a different scene. The lounge we enjoyed the night before had transformed into a bustling workspace, making it nearly impossible to find a table without a laptop and customers focused on their work. Large tables were often occupied by single individuals with their computers. This was a consistent situation throughout our stay, leading us to spend our time outside the hotel, where we could enjoy quiet conversations without the office atmosphere.||I would love to return, but I’d prefer to avoid weekdays when the space feels more like a workplace.

Where do I begin? Soho House can be good. This location is beautiful and I think that is the best thing about it: the beautiful building with incredible rooftop views. Unfortunately the place gets full of business guys in business casual attire doing lame business meetings. I heard Soho House was different? I guess not? Whatever.

The food and drinks here are really good. They have guest chefs and a really solid cocktail menu. Once they even had a special cocktail menu to match the guest chef. Really cool. Coming here for a cocktail on the roof at the end of a night out can be really special and relaxing.

Unfortunately the staff here always hassles you here to order something if you're just sitting and chilling on your phone or computer. Seems like you can't escape someone asking you if you're okay or if you want to eat or drink something. Also related: they pressure you for a tip afterwards. Specifically was asked once with that weird tactic "what would you like the total to be?" 🙄  I guess Soho House isn't paying it's staff well enough? Honestly I didn't expect them to even take tips as it's kind of tacky and weird to make your servers fight for tips… just pay them well, it's easy.

If you're coming here to get some work done, be prepared to eat or drink something. Like, I don't know why this wasn't clear before I became a member, but Soho House is basically just a huge restaurant. Apparently even the designated coworking space in the back is "a restaurant." I once brought some of my own food in to eat while working and was told I couldn't eat while working "because this is a restaurant." Mind you, I'm working in the very back corner of the downstairs area (the area designated for working). Funnily enough, when I visited Soho House Paris, I felt totally comfortable and welcomed by the staff. I didn't even stay at the hotel, and was only coming there to work on a daily basis, and still it was really lovely and the staff made me feel so welcome. But nah, there is no where in Soho House where you can just chill without being constantly bothered to buy something.

A note on the gym: if you're serious about lifting weights, it can often be a struggle to get in a good workout. While the gym area is pretty big, with really nice equipment, it's almost always full. And with only a single bench press, and only a single cable weight machine, I often found myself waiting on someone to be finished. Meanwhile there are like 10 treadmills and 5 peloton bikes, so if you want to do cardio, you're good.

La SoHo House di Amsterdam risiede in un palazzo spettacolare, con vetrate dipinte e un’atmosfera bellissima. La posizione è praticamente perfetta, a due passi da piazza Dam e con vista sui canali questa location non vi deluderà. La vista dal rooftop è in generale da tut te le finestre è veramente bella e caratteristica. Parlando delle stanze: avevo letto molte recensioni che si lamentavano dei rumori quindi prima di prenotare mi sono fatta assicurare di avere una stanza lontana dal club e da tutti i possibili disturbi. La nostra stanza categoria Small numero 42 era silenziosa e con vista sul canale e con abbastanza spazio e luce. Letto comodissimo, abbiamo dormito molto bene. Prodotti bagnoschiuma, pettini, creme in dotazione nella stanza meravigliosi. Aumenterei la luce in bagno. Oppure aggiungerei degli specchi trucco con la luce forte. Durante il soggiorno ho approfittato della palestra (meravigliosa) e del centro massaggi. Vi consiglio di prenotare un massaggio con l’operatore Siwat, non ve ne pentirete. Per quanto riguarda le cose da migliorare: l’area della piscina secondo me necessita di un po’ di lavoro. I letti dove fanno sdraiare gli ospiti non vengono puliti e sistemati tra un’ospite e l’altro quindi non è molto invogliante sdraiarsi in costume vedendo un materasso sfatto e pieno di briciole. Mi è capitato due volte su due. La piscina è molto piccola come nella maggior parte delle SoHo House, ma la vista è molto bella. Un’altra cosa che inizierei a considerare fossi in loro è la possibilità di prevedere una colazione anche piccola da includere per gli ospiti dell’hotel. Farei un refill dei biscottini inclusi ne avevano lasciati solo due e visto che non c è la colazione almeno i biscotti nella postazione potrebbero rimetterli ogni giorno in quantità un po’ maggiori. Il personale è stato gentile e disponibile con noi, niente da dire. Attenzione alle chiavi della vostra stanza: se le perdete vi caricano 250 euro sul conto.

cleanliness_negative.text: no hygiene and needed to make a drug test if you ate after chefs party in the kitchen.

By far the worst Soho House I've been to across the globe. The service is non-existent. I've walked out multiple times after sitting for +15min with no service, or a waiter dropping a menu then never coming back.

If you're becoming a member or staying here for the pool use, think again. It's over-crowded by 9am all summer and absolutely filthy. They don't clean it on mornings after a busy day so be prepared to swim around in nothing but garbage from the day before.

If you're a member so that you can attend the events, their booking system is awful. You can never get tickets to anything (even right when they release) and if you turn up to the events you always see the same handful of people inside. It's clearly not a fair allocations system at all, or whoever runs it is just giving access to friends before anyone else.

Overall this place is not worth coming to, let alone the high membership fee associated unless you want to use it for the other houses globally

If you’re planning to stay at Soho House Berlin, I sincerely recommend you don’t leave your room, it’s the only part of the hotel that actually works.

The rooms themselves are beautiful, no complaints there. Everything else, however, is a masterclass in chaos. The reception is unreliable, the tables in the club look like they haven’t seen a cleaning cloth in weeks, and most of the staff seem to have graduated from the “how to be rude 101” training program. With one shining exception, a single girl who was genuinely helpful, everyone else operates on the level of a budget hostel rather than a so-called five-star establishment.

And let’s be clear: laziness cannot be justified by “Soho House values alignment.” It’s not charming, it’s not “community spirit,” and it’s definitely not “cool.” It’s simply unprofessional. That kind of attitude might fly in a place where guests stay for free and staff aren’t being paid, but when I’m paying full price, I expect at least the basics of hospitality.

At some point, I realized I was doing more work than the staff, and when you politely remind them that service is, in fact, their job, they somehow manage to take offense. Quite an experience.

Unfortunately, disappointing and also unhealthy environment.
I had hoped not to write this, but something needs to change. The hygiene at Soho House Amsterdam is alarming.
Here are just a few items from a long list:
-Mold issues in all shower cabins in the sports section!
-Mold in the sauna and steam room!
-Defective lights in the toilets
-Dirty sports equipment, visibly unclean
-Plumbing problems
-Broken toilet flush buttons

Very disappointing experience. I booked Soho House Paris for my one night in the city, expecting the same high standard I remembered from Barcelona — although even there my friend had an issue where her necklace went missing and was only “found” by the cleaning staff after she raised the alarm.

In Paris, the receptionist was rude and told me I had to pay an unexpected €100 membership fee that wasn’t mentioned at booking. My room was so tiny I could barely move. Late at night, I came back to find a fight at reception between 5–6 men, creating a very unsafe atmosphere.

The final bill jumped from €265 to €420 without explanation. Only after I complained and mentioned leaving a bad review did they remove the membership fee — yet they still charged me for in-room coffee that any decent hotel includes for free.

For these prices, you can find far better, safer, and truly high-class hotels in Paris. Definitely not recommended.

location_negative.text: the place is in a good location, close to the city center, you can find pubs/shops/restaurants ariund as well. However, my room was dirty, I found multiple hair in my bed; thr duvet was cover in stains. I would not recommend as I expected a higher standard that basic cleanliness

The hotel was in a great location. The staff were lovely and let us upgrade to the loft room. The original room we booked was right next to the lift and close to closing doors which made a very loud noise. The room was not clean. The loft room which the staff upgraded us to was very dirty. There were stains on the bed. The bathroom was really dirty with stains and dirt everywhere. It looked like the room was not cleaned for a while. The hotel does not provide daily cleaning as it’s a self contained apartment. We asked for cleaning and still, the room was really dirty and uncomfortable. It’s a shame as the rest of the stay was great.

Pros: stylish vibe and clever storage in the rooms. Feels like you’re in room from a stylish version of IKEA.

Cons: Customer service is non existent, which killed our experience, plus rooms are stuffy and very small. When we had issues with the AC malfunctioning, the front desk did nothing to fix it and it took repeated calls to get it addressed. As a result, we spent 2 nights tossing and turning in an overheated room before the problem was fixed.  Location is in a business park that’s far from central Copenhagen and there are very few restaurants or places to see within walking distance. Lots of road noise

Conclusion: Not recommended

A space designed for young entrepreneurs. Oddly, the rooms have been designed around the concept of holding business meetings and the bed is viewed as something secondary/less important. The designer thought it more important to give their guests a giant table and hide the bed in an elevated cage. Fine, if you are a “young, single entrepreneur” who loves the nostalgia of childhood bunk beds and dens, not so great when you’re a middle aged couple, on their holiday. The chore of climbing over your sleeping other half to use the bathroom, highlighted how this room was designed on novelty, rather than function. The pointless gymnasium rings hanging from the ceiling supported this attraction to playful novelty.

Do be aware of the constant hum of an air filtration system, with an extra vent inside your bed cage.

We did ask if we could change rooms, to a more conventional room with a bed accessible from both sides, but we were told they were designed for customers with disabilities and all were currently occupied.

The roof top reception lounge and restaurant is a great space, but this is taken over with people working and team meetings, so not somewhere you would be comfortable being, while on holiday. The breakfast is excellent, with good healthy options. The location is close to the metro station and university. 30 minutes walk into town.

If you value sleep and comfort, over team meetings, Zoku is not for you. It is not a great sign, when you look forward to going home, so you can finally get a good nights sleep.

If we visited Copenhagen again, we would stay more central, in a hotel that placed the bed as the most important part of the room.

30 years of incident-free travel ended this week after my cash went missing after I checked into the Zoku Paris. I had stayed here before, and at their property in Amsterdam a few years ago, and was always impressed with the properties - and why I rebooked here. I forgot there was a safe in the room  - so part of this issue is on me. I told reception about the money missing late Friday afternoon, and the kind staff person was apologetic and said he’d contact the manager to respond. About an hour later I checked in again, and was told the manager was reviewing video and would connect with me. No one followed up. I checked out this morning and still no response from the hotel. I appreciate the convenient location of the hotel, and the quality of the rooms, but I can’t stay here again if I’m left with any suspicion about theft; and the lack of response from management.

May 16 - Several folks contacted me wondering if there was any resolution.

I contacted the hotel, as they suggested, but there was no response. I contacted them again about a week later, and they replied, and a phone call was arranged.

I was up front about my mistake re: the safe, and acknowledging I agreed to the terms of their agreement when making a reservation which talks about lost/stolen property.

They admitted mishandling communication with me - in particular not contacting me between the time I reported the money missing on Friday afternoon until I checked out on Monday morning. They admitted they should have immediately offered to move me to a different room. They admitted they should have offered to assist me in making a complaint to the police. They said the hotel terminated the employment of the staff who was in my room from housekeeping. They apologized for the poor communication and their other mistakes.

They offered to give me a 15 percent discount on the cost of a future stay at any Zoku hotel, along with dinner and drinks. While I've enjoyed previous stays with them I don't consider that to be much of an incentive to trust the brand again.

They assured me actions have been put in place to ensure the situation doesn't happen again.

room_quality_negative.text: the place is in a good location, close to the city center, you can find pubs/shops/restaurants ariund as well. However, my room was dirty, I found multiple hair in my bed; thr duvet was cover in stains. I would not recommend as I expected a higher standard that basic cleanliness

On our last morning, we cooked breakfast in the kitchen provided which apparently triggered a silent fire alarm. Two women started banging on our door, yelling for us to open immediately. We said there's no fire and asked for a minute since we were both undressed but they were shouting that we have to open the door immediately.

There's a smoking fine and they probably assumed we were lying and tried to "catch us".
They barged in, trampled on my clean clothes, opened a window, and left without an apology.

Additionally we had decided to extend the stay by 3 days. For 3 days our key cards stopped working and we had to reset them each time. To top it off there's no real reception, there's a bar on the top floor where the staff will help you when they finish making drinks?

Overall it was disappointing. If you plan to use the kitchen, better do it fully dressed.

Interior design is great overall and is definitely the highlight. Unfortunately the bathroom door was broken so our bathroom was flooded after shower. The staff was quite helpful in providing more towels but there’s nothing much we could do at late night.

The charging near bed was also not working.  We had booked a more expensive room hence would have a higher expectation.
Awful.  No room service and no housekeeping.  Apparently I should have been informed that I could request housekeeping - I was not.  If you are a busy business traveller - best avoided

BEWARE OF THEFT. It’s unfortunate I have to post this but I think it’s important to note when choosing to stay at what you assume is a highly rated establishment. Similar to another review I’ve read here, Zoku housekeeping “could not find” an item I left in the room. This is extremely hard to believe given it’s at least $2000 euros in value and regardless of the value, the standard hotel policy is to hold onto a lost & found item for 90 days. I reported this missing item 4 days after my stay and it took them another 5 days with barely any correspondence in between to plainly tell me that housekeeping did not find it - not a single apology for even taking so long to reply. As others have also mentioned here, it’s likely the case that this item was discarded or stolen, both outcomes I deem very shocking for a hotel like this in Copenhagen.

The housekeeping staff in general is extremely rude and before this incident was disappointing. We were not informed during check in that we have to tidy our own rooms using the pantry on each floor, so we asked one of the housekeeping staff if we could just please have new towels. Instead of directing us to the pantry or handing us some towels from her cart, she literally scoffed at us that “it’s not possible” so we had to go all the way to the lobby to ask how we can get any towels or cleaning.

Unfortunately the restaurant staff was bad service all round - no drinks menus, no service although we asked to order three times and were fully ignored. We also received raw chicken.. Ivar jumped in and was a great help which made the experience a lot better.

Instead of directing us to the pantry or handing us some towels from her cart, she literally scoffed at us that “it’s not possible” so we had to go all the way to the lobby to ask how we can get any towels or cleaning.

Mixed Experience – Great Concept, But Inconsistent Execution

My first impression was 5-star – the spacious loft-style rooms are amazing. However, several issues affected my stay:

Early Check-Out Confusion: Staff mistakenly insisted I check out on June 28th (my original date was June 30th, extended to July 2nd). I had to show my reservation to resolve this.

Incorrect Charges: They tried to overcharge me by €150, claiming a "rate change," but corrected it after I showed proof of payment.

Forced Upgrade Fee: When extending, I was told only larger rooms were available and had to pay an extra €40.

No Late Check-Out Flexibility: After 6 nights, they refused a 1-hour late check-out without a €25 fee.

Additional Concerns:

Disappointing cleanliness standards—linens, kitchen utensils, and towels had an unpleasant smell.

The couch in Room 520 had a strong odor, making it unusable.

While staff were young and friendly, their empathy often felt forced or insincere (except for Rod at reception, who was genuinely welcoming).

Despite these frustrations, I love Zoku’s unique loft concept and will give them another chance, hoping for better consistency next time.

location_positive.text: Perfect place to stay in Amsterdam. The location was excellent. You are close to everything but out of the noise. The rooms are perfect and really feel like a little home away from home. We love to do our own cooking so having access to the kitchen is great. Most of the time when we travel we look for a rooftop to hang out on, but at Zoku you have access to a beautiful one right on site. This was my second Zoku location and it was just as perfect as the first, maybe even better.

We missed our flight connection and had to stay in Amsterdam for the night (literally thr best place to be "stuck." We found this gem via google. Great location, very clean, beautiful bar and lounge area. Room was comfortable and quiet. We will definitely return next time we visit.

When I first started staying here, I met Preet, and I was immediately impressed by her positive energy. She is always friendly, approachable, and helpful, which makes me feel very welcome and comfortable—especially as a long-term guest. This enhances the overall experience and gives me great confidence in the service here. Everyone is very friendly and always willing to help.
In addition, the hotel is in a great location and has a wonderful terrace, which makes the stay even more enjoyable.

I stayed for a long weekend and felt completely at home here.  The hotel is located in a quiet area within walking distance of the train and the lovely (albeit small) botanical gardens.  There is a market a half a block away.  The bed was comfortable and the kitchen had everything I needed for a long work weekend.  The lounge/lobby upstairs is an inspiring spot for getting work done.

Odamız Loft odadaydı. Her şey çok ince düşünülmüştü, neredeyse her şey vardı. Merdivenle yatağa çıkmak hem eğlenceli hem de gece yarısı lavaboya giderken biraz riskli gibi geldi bana. Uyku sersemiyken bir an merdivenden düşecekmiş gibi oluyor insan, alışılmış bir yatak arıyor bazen. Dört gece konakladık. Kahvaltısından çok memnun kaldık. Otel her detayı ile çok güzel düşünülmüş. Hayran kaldık. Üst katlarda Street view odalarından birinde kalmanızı tavsiye ederiz. Özellikle 4. Kat çok daha ferah. Genel olarak çalışanlar gayet iyiydi. Sara ve Iris ise çok özel insanlar 🙏. Metroya çok yakın (2-3 dakika) ve ulaşım her yere çok kolay. Bilenin kalabileceği rafine bir otel. Kesinlikle tavsiye ederiz.

What a wonderful stay! From the moment I arrived, I felt at home. The design is modern ar cozy, full of small details that make life easier and more beautiful. The rooftop terrace is absolutely amazing - calm and perfect for morning coffee or evening sunsets. The staff are kind and welcoming, always ready to help with a smile.

Zoku is not just a hotel - it feels like a little community, where you can relax, work, and feel inspired. I would love to come back!
Really cool and spacious room and the roof bar is awesome with great ambiance.

I would say that the lift is a real problem. with so many guests that come from the outside to have brunch and dinner the lifts easily get way too crowded and one waits forever to find a open lift to come to your floor. Also, for first time guests arriving for breakfast seems odd as it feels like there is no one to help or 'check you in', the staff seem limited and often one waits to be let in to get a table.

Very nice place to stay in Copenhagen. Spacious, clean, comfortable, much better than a hotel.
Even not being in the city center, it is well communicated and you can get everywhere in just some minutes.
Atmosphere is very nice and you feel at home every time.

​One of the best places I've ever stayed. The rooms are clean and thoughtfully designed.
​The bed was so comfortable, with cozy, luxurious blankets. The room is fully equipped with everything you could need.
​There's a small kitchenette with dishes, a fridge, a coffee machine, and even a dishwasher. The bathroom is also large and well-equipped.
​A great feature is the supply room on each floor—if you run out of anything like toilet paper, towels, or soap, you can just grab more yourself.
​The automated check-in process was fast and simple, with no clerk needed.
​The hotel also has a great rooftop bar with a young, lively atmosphere and delicious food.
​The location is excellent and very convenient, right across from the Holocaust Memorial of the Dutch Jews and close to the metro, tram, and bus stations. It's also just about a 20-minute walk from Dam Square.
​The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming.
​We truly enjoyed every moment and felt completely at home. It was so comfortable and pleasant!
​Thank you for a perfect stay.
​

We had an excellent stay at Zoku Copenhagen! The loft was clean, comfortable and quiet, not to mention, stylish. The staff were fantastic , from our check in to our departure, they were absolutely amazing. The hotel is 2 minutes walk from the metro so easily accessible to get to anywhere in the city center and a lovely walk to take the boat as well. There is even a store right next door to grab groceries if you aren't up for eating out. I would highly recommend Zoku !

wifi_positive.text: We missed our flight connection and had to stay in Amsterdam for the night (literally thr best place to be "stuck." We found this gem via google. Great location, very clean, beautiful bar and lounge area. Room was comfortable and quiet. We will definitely return next time we visit.

Overall a great place to stay if you want to be in the center of Amsterdam. You’re in walking distance of many museums, coffee shops and restaurants and more. The staff is super friendly and the food they provide is delicious ⭐️I’m giving a 4/5 because the WiFi is spotty and drops a lot of I recommend to work in the coworking area for less WiFi drops.

A very good hotel in a convenient location in city center, close to the subway and easy to reach from anywhere, by public transport or on foot. All the amenities worked properly, except for the WiFi which was spotty, the staff was very  helpful and offered us an effective solution. Highly recommended, including excellent breakfast 👍

Living at Zoku Copenhagen combines the functionality of an apartment with the comfort of a hotel and a dedicated workspace. The micro-apartments are well designed – they include a sleeping area, kitchen, large work surface, and big window panels (which I personally really like), offering both comfort and privacy. Additionally, there’s a coworking space, bar, restaurant, and networking events on-site, which support remote work and social interaction. The location near the metro makes it easy to reach the city center quickly. It’s a great place to live, work, and connect

The hotel is really nice, clean and well organised, it also has different topical nights either professionally oriented or some cultural event. It has a nice restaurant/bar with view. It also offers bike rentals. It’s easy to get to by metro from the airport by switching a metro line and still gets you there for about 20min. It has a quick connection to city Center again by metro or by bike for about 15 min both methods. There are also a couple of stores right nearby. I recommend the hotel if anyone is visiting the Concert hall since it’s like 2 min away.

Really cool and spacious room and the roof bar is awesome with great ambiance.

service_positive.text:
When I first started staying here, I met Preet, and I was immediately impressed by her positive energy. She is always friendly, approachable, and helpful, which makes me feel very welcome and comfortable—especially as a long-term guest. This enhances the overall experience and gives me great confidence in the service here. Everyone is very friendly and always willing to help.
In addition, the hotel is in a great location and has a wonderful terrace, which makes the stay even more enjoyable.

Don't get me wrong, very nice hotel and the rooms are homely, clean and well equipped. Staff are friendly and the terrace has a great view. Breakfast is amazing and although I did not have dinner, Im sure it would be good too.

I would say that the lift is a real problem. with so many guests that come from the outside to have brunch and dinner the lifts easily get way too crowded and one waits forever to find a open lift to come to your floor. Also, for first time guests arriving for breakfast seems odd as it feels like there is no one to help or 'check you in', the staff seem limited and often one waits to be let in to get a table.

What a wonderful stay! From the moment I arrived, I felt at home. The design is modern ar cozy, full of small details that make life easier and more beautiful. The rooftop terrace is absolutely amazing - calm and perfect for morning coffee or evening sunsets. The staff are kind and welcoming, always ready to help with a smile.

Zoku is not just a hotel - it feels like a little community, where you can relax, work, and feel inspired. I would love to come back!

It’s not a luxury hotel (it’s not even trying to be) and it’s a bit too expensive. Other than that - there is not much to complain about. You get exactly what you signed up for. Overall vibe is very friendly and positive.
Funky loft rooms.  Awesome vibe.  Staff is warm and interesting

service_negative.text:
On our last morning, we cooked breakfast in the kitchen provided which apparently triggered a silent fire alarm. Two women started banging on our door, yelling for us to open immediately. We said there's no fire and asked for a minute since we were both undressed but they were shouting that we have to open the door immediately.

There's a smoking fine and they probably assumed we were lying and tried to "catch us".
They barged in, trampled on my clean clothes, opened a window, and left without an apology.

Additionally we had decided to extend the stay by 3 days. For 3 days our key cards stopped working and we had to reset them each time. To top it off there's no real reception, there's a bar on the top floor where the staff will help you when they finish making drinks?

Overall it was disappointing. If you plan to use the kitchen, better do it fully dressed.

My lovely one-week stay has been marred by the total inability to communicate with hotel staff after departure. All I need is an invoice detailing the charges so I can submit expenses with my company. This should be entirely routine for a hotel that is billed as a co-working space. Unfortunately, it's been 8 days since my departure and still nothing despite five attempts, by five different methods, to get through to someone. Very frustrating.

Interior design is great overall and is definitely the highlight. Unfortunately the bathroom door was broken so our bathroom was flooded after shower. The staff was quite helpful in providing more towels but there’s nothing much we could do at late night.

The charging near bed was also not working.  We had booked a more expensive room hence would have a higher expectation.
Awful.  No room service and no housekeeping.  Apparently I should have been informed that I could request housekeeping - I was not.  If you are a busy business traveller - best avoided

The hotel was in a great location. The staff were lovely and let us upgrade to the loft room. The original room we booked was right next to the lift and close to closing doors which made a very loud noise. The room was not clean. The loft room which the staff upgraded us to was very dirty. There were stains on the bed. The bathroom was really dirty with stains and dirt everywhere. It looked like the room was not cleaned for a while. The hotel does not provide daily cleaning as it’s a self contained apartment. We asked for cleaning and still, the room was really dirty and uncomfortable. It’s a shame as the rest of the stay was great.

It’s a shame as the rest of the stay was great.

Pros: stylish vibe and clever storage in the rooms. Feels like you’re in room from a stylish version of IKEA.

Cons: Customer service is non existent, which killed our experience, plus rooms are stuffy and very small. When we had issues with the AC malfunctioning, the front desk did nothing to fix it and it took repeated calls to get it addressed. As a result, we spent 2 nights tossing and turning in an overheated room before the problem was fixed.  Location is in a business park that’s far from central Copenhagen and there are very few restaurants or places to see within walking distance. Lots of road noise

Conclusion: Not recommended

Pros: The place is really clean, we've stayed for 4 days and they've clean it on our 3rd day. Room is nice, there's a small kitchen pantry in the room and a nice spacious table to sit and work. There's a unique and nice rooftop cafe/lobby/communal area on the 5th floor, the concept and interior design is cool/pretty/hygge style. I love how they have a chef cooking eggs in the morning for breakfast and sometimes the coffee taste really nice at the coffee machine.

Cons: However, when we first arrive, we got a bit confused, we can't tell that the rooftop is a lobby to check-in, a place to sit and relax/work or a cafe/bar? Appearently it's all in one 😅 there's a time I brought my own pastries to eat while waiting to collect my lugguage from the locker room, one of the staff rudely just went "you can't eat outside food here". If You have an integrated cafe/lobby/resting/working area all together, where was I suppose to sit and munch on my small pastry while I check out? The staff should have told me politely to not have something outside here or ask me if I want to buy a drink because I wanted to buy a coffee but no one attended to me so I grab a glass of water instead. Also, not alot of choices of food during breakfast, lunch and dinner. Although the Live music on Saturday night was good, it was too loud, I hardly can have a proper conversation while we sit, drink tea and relax cause we can't hear one another.

Will I recommend this place to stay? Yes. But I would also recommend that staff is being trained well.
The rooms are apparently not very well isolated, the music from the prater is really loud.

room_quality_neutral.text: I stayed at the Zoku for a long weekend.  The hotel is located in a perfect spot -- close to the center of the city but far enough to avoid crowds.  The lobby/lounge area is an inspiring place to get work done, if you happen to be traveling for business.   The employees in reception and at the coffee bar were helpful and kind.  I slept  so well in my comfortable bed.

I really enjoyed my stay and the rooftop was amazing. The atmosphere was great and the hotel is located aprox 15mins walking distance from the center.
Sadly the room was not clean at all, i found used contact lenses in my bed. Dried up stains of brown liquid in the bathroom, closet, and spots that werent properly cleaned next to my bed. The kitchen coffee machine was dirty too and the whole kitchen was covered in dust. The hotel is not cheap at least in my opinion and even if it were it wouldnt really excuse the lack of cleanliness, this was a real bummer to my experience because the rest of the hotel was so great.

Was here 14/07/25.. This is a fantastic place to stay.. A real cool concept and a really cool looking place internally.. They have great style and the rooms reflect that.. Stayed in a loft XL and the bed took me back to building a fort as a kid.., it was so so cool.. And super comfy bed.. The staff are super friendly and helpful.. The place is clean and tidy and modern and has great chill spots on the 6th floor as you walk through to the bar/food/chill/living area.. Location is beautiful and offers some good views locally and there are metro and tram stops very close by that get you anywhere you need.. As well as the views there are some nice spots to eat close by.. Again...., wonderful stay here at Zoku... Thank you again guys.. ❤️

the XL loft was spacious and the bed was super comfortable. the rooftop space was perfect for remote work, especially as i worked on the eastern US timezone. location was great for a first time visitor with a bike.

Perfect stay in every way.  The room lives up to all the photos online.  Clean crisp, comfortable, cool, efficient.  Staff are amazing and accomodating, going the extra mile to accomodate requests.  Having the option to work from a large table in your room, or surrounded by activity in the top floor lounge, allows you to customize your work day to   Breakfast, lunch, and dinner...the restaurant is amazing!

Having the option to work from a large table in your room, or surrounded by activity in the top floor lounge, allows you to customize your work day to   Breakfast, lunch, and dinner...the restaurant is amazing!

I stayed at this hotel for one month and had mixed feelings about the experience. On the positive side, the rooms are set up more like small serviced apartments, which is very convenient for longer stays. Having your own kitchen and a separate seating area adds a level of comfort and independence that standard hotel rooms often lack.

Another highlight is the rooftop terrace — beautifully decorated and offering a lovely view over Amsterdam. It’s a great spot to relax, and it's also accessible to non-hotel guests!

However, the price point does not match the overall quality and experience. First of all, cleanliness is a real issue. While you can request cleaning, it is done very superficially. Stains and dust remain. This gives the entire place a neglected feel.

But the biggest disappointment was the overall environment. We had expected a more peaceful, community-oriented atmosphere with other long-term residents such as expats or professionals. Instead, the building feels more like a student dorm. Hallways are often messy, trash is left around, there’s a persistent smell of weed in the elevators and common areas, and noise at night is constant — with people slamming doors and shouting in the hallways, waking us up multiple times.

While the hotel markets itself as a long-term living solution or community, it doesn’t live up to that promise. If you’re looking for a quiet, comfortable, and well-maintained place to stay for a longer period in Amsterdam, I would recommend looking into Airbnb options, renting an apartment, or spending a little more for a proper hotel experience. Unfortunately, this property falls short on many fronts — and for the price, it simply isn’t worth it for a longer period.

Side note: Long-term guests only receive one free laundry cycle during their stay, which seems rather limited and not particularly guest-friendly. Additionally, we were left without coffee cups in our room for over two weeks due to “ordering issues” — small things, but they add up during a longer stay.
Very good hotel! The rooms are clean and spacious. |The staff was friendly and helpful :) |Breakfast was delicious and a lot of choices.|Everything was excellent!
